original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ma h'a y'a na sam gra ha /
analyzed: ma h'a y'a na sam gra ha /
translated: Mahāyānasamgraha

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa /
translated: Compendium of the Mahāyāna

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: First part

original: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'od dpag tu med pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa 'od dpag tu med pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Noble Amitābha and to Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: theg pa chen po la shin tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la shin tu zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas /
translated: A bodhisattva who has thoroughly entered the Mahāyāna,

original: theg pa chen po'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the greatness of the Mahāyāna,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'di lta ste /
translated: in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: theg pa chen po las brtsams nas /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las brtsams nas /
translated: beginning with the Mahāyāna,

original: chos mngon pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa theg pa chen po'i mdo las /
translated: in the Abhidharma of the Mahāyāna sūtras,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs te /
translated: the special qualities of the speech of the Blessed Buddhas are said to be superior in ten ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung zhes bya ba'i gnas kyi khyad par du 'phags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid de la 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang /🔽de la 'jug @2a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung zhes bya ba'i gnas kyi khyad par du 'phags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa dang / shes bya'i mtshan nyid de la 'jug pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de la 'jug @2a * //
translated: It is superior in terms of the special place called the speech of the bhagavat buddhas, it is superior in terms of the special characteristics called the speech of the bhagavat buddhas, it is superior in terms of the special engagement with the characteristics of objects of knowledge,

original: pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsungs dang / bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba de nyid la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsungs dang /
analyzed: pa de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsungs dang / bsgom pa rab tu dbye ba de nyid la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsungs dang /
translated: it is superior in terms of the special cause and result of that engagement, it is superior in terms of the special divisions of the meditation on its cause and result, it is superior in terms of the special superior ethics in that meditation,

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i 'bras bu spangs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i 'bras bu spangs pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung dang / de'i 'bras bu ye shes kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: The speech of the Buddhas is superior by reason of the excellence of their mind, by reason of the excellence of their wisdom, by reason of the excellence of their abandonment, and by reason of the excellence of their intuition.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdo sde'i tshig bstan pa 'di ni theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdo sde'i tshig bstan pa 'di ni theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the word of the Sutras by the Lord Buddhas is declared to be the word of the Buddha of the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How is it declared?

original: 'di ltar bstan pa 'dis /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa 'dis /
translated: In this way, by this teaching,

original: nyan thos kyi theg par gang dag ma bstan pa'i gnas bcu po dag theg pa chen po las bstan te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par gang dag ma bstan pa'i gnas bcu po dag theg pa chen po las bstan te /
translated: the ten topics which are not taught in the Vehicle of the Audi-tors are taught in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni shes bya'i gnas su bstan to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni shes bya'i gnas su bstan to //
translated: The foundation consciousness is taught as the basis of knowables.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po gzhan gyi dbang dang / kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa dag ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid du bstan te //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po gzhan gyi dbang dang / kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa dag ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid du bstan te //
translated: The three realities, the relative, imagined, and perfect, are taught as the characteristics of the knowable.

original: rnam par @2b rig pa tsam nyid ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par @2b rig pa tsam nyid ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par bstan to //
translated: The mere representation of consciousness is taught as the entry into the characteristics of the knowable.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni de la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni de la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bur bstan to //
translated: The six perfections are taught as the cause and result of that entry.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po dag ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bsgom pa rab tu dbye bar bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po dag ni de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bsgom pa rab tu dbye bar bstan to //
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages are taught as the division of the cultivation of the cause and result of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni der lhag pa'i tshul khrims su bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni der lhag pa'i tshul khrims su bstan to //
translated: The bodhisattva vow is taught as the superior morality there.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag ni der lhag pa'i sems su bstan to //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag ni der lhag pa'i sems su bstan to //
translated: The samadhis such as the Heroic and the Sky Treasury are taught as the superior mind there.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni lhag pa'i shes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni lhag pa'i shes rab tu bstan to //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition is taught as the superior wisdom there.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni de'i 'bras bu spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni de'i 'bras bu spangs par bstan to //
translated: The result of that is the abandonment of nonabiding nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum ste /
translated: The three bodies of the Buddha

original: ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ni de'i 'bras bu ye shes su bstan to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa ni de'i 'bras bu ye shes su bstan to //
translated: svabhavikakaya, sambhogikakaya, and nairmanikakaya are taught as the result of that, as gnosis.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du byas pa gnas bcu po 'di dag ni gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams nas /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las khyad par du byas pa gnas bcu po 'di dag ni gang dag bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams nas /
translated: These ten topics, distinguished from the sravaka vehicle, are those which the Lord, beginning with the bodhisattvas,

original: theg pa chen po las khyad par du 'phags pa mchog nyid du bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: theg pa chen po las khyad par du 'phags pa mchog nyid du bstan pa dag go //
translated: has taught as the most excellent and sublime in the Mahayana.

original: de bas na theg pa chen po las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na theg pa chen po las brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, beginning with the Mahayana,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags par shes par bya'o //
translated: the speech of the Lord Buddha is to be understood as sublime in ten respects.

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gsheg pa'i gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags pa 'dis theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gsheg pa'i gsung khyad par rnam pa bcus khyad par du 'phags pa 'dis theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin la /
translated: The speech of the Tathagata is superior in ten ways.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen por mi chud par bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni theg pa chen por mi chud par bkag pa yin te /
translated: The Hinayana is not included in the Mahayana, because

original: 'di ltar gnas bcu po 'di dag nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni bstan par mi snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas bcu po 'di dag nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni bstan par mi snang la /
translated: these ten topics do not appear in the Hinayana,

original: theg pa chen po la ni snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ni snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: but they do appear in the Mahayana.

original: gnas bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub chen po kun tu sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub chen po kun tu sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: These ten topics are the means of achieving great enlightenment,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par shin tu 'thad pa mthun pa 'gal ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par shin tu 'thad pa mthun pa 'gal ba med pa'o //
translated: because they are very reasonable, consistent, and noncontradictory in attaining the gnosis of omniscience.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: shes bya'i gnas dang mtshan nyid der 'jug dang ; ; de yi rgyu 'bras de rab dbye ba dang // bslab pa gsum dang de 'bras spangs pa dang // ye shes theg pa mchog gyur khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: shes bya'i gnas dang mtshan nyid der 'jug dang ; ; de yi rgyu 'bras de rab dbye ba dang // bslab pa gsum dang de 'bras spangs pa dang // ye shes theg pa mchog gyur khyad par 'phags //
translated: and pristine wisdom are the distinctive features of the supreme vehicle.

original: bstan 'di 'di ltar gzhan na ma mthong la //
analyzed: bstan 'di 'di ltar gzhan na ma mthong la //
translated: This teaching is not seen in any other system.

original: 'di dag byang chub mchog gi rgyur mthong bas //
analyzed: 'di dag byang chub mchog gi rgyur mthong bas //
translated: These are seen as the causes of supreme enlightenment.

original: gnas bcu bstan pas khyad par zhugs @3a * //🔽gang yin pa //
analyzed: gnas bcu bstan pas khyad par zhugs @3a * // gang yin pa //
translated: The distinctive features are the ten topics.

original: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas bkar 'dod do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas bkar 'dod do //
translated: The Mahayana is accepted as the Buddha’s word.

original: ci'i phyir gnas bcu po 'di dag gi go rims 'di ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas bcu po 'di dag gi go rims 'di ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are these ten topics taught in this order?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas thog ma nyid du re zhig chos rnams kyi rgyu la mkhas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas thog ma nyid du re zhig chos rnams kyi rgyu la mkhas pa la brten nas /
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva first, on the basis of skill in the causes of phenomena,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: should become skilled in dependent origination.

original: de'i 'og tu sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba la mkhas pa nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba la mkhas pa nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Then, having taken up the skill in completely avoiding the faults of exaggeration and deprecation,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag gi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos de dag gi mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: one should become skilled in the characteristics of those things that are dependently arisen.

original: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpas mtshan nyid shin tu bzung ba de rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu sbyor ba'i byang chub sems dpas mtshan nyid shin tu bzung ba de rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is thus engaged should realize the well-taken characteristics,

original: des sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i 'og tu shes bya'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa la brten te /
analyzed: des sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro // de'i 'og tu shes bya'i mtshan nyid rtogs nas lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa la brten te /
translated: and thereby his mind will be liberated from the obscurations.

original: sngon sbyor ba can gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rtogs par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon sbyor ba can gyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rtogs par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Then, having realized the characteristics of the knowable, he should accomplish the realization of the six perfections that have been previously practiced, relying on the purity of superior intention.

original: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas yongs su bzung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag sa bcu dag tu rab tu phye ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas yongs su bzung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag sa bcu dag tu rab tu phye ste /
translated: Then, having taken up those six perfections with pure superior intention, he should distinguish them in the ten stages.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate it for three incalculable eons.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gsum po dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa gsum po dag yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Then, after that, one should perfect the three trainings of the bodhisattva.

original: yongs su rdzogs nas de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs nas de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ste /
translated: Having perfected them, one should attain nirvana, the fruit of those, and fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: gnas bcu po de dag gi go rims ni de ltar bstan to //
analyzed: gnas bcu po de dag gi go rims ni de ltar bstan to //
translated: The order of these ten topics is presented in that way.

original: bstan pa 'dir ni theg pa chen po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no ;
analyzed: bstan pa 'dir ni theg pa chen po thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no ;
translated: In this presentation, the entire Great Vehicle is complete.

original: ; de la re zhig thog ma kho nar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni shes bya'i gnas so zhes brjod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pas /
analyzed: ; de la re zhig thog ma kho nar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni shes bya'i gnas so zhes brjod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bstan pas /
translated: In that regard, first of all, the Bhagavān taught the foundation consciousness, saying, “The foundation consciousness is the basis of knowables.”

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang du bstan zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Where was the foundation consciousness taught?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las tshigs su bcad de /
translated: The Bhagavān taught it in verse in the Abhidharma Sūtra:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi dbyings //
translated: The realm of reality without beginning or end

original: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi gnas yin te //
translated: is the abode of all phenomena.🔽Because it exists, all beings

original: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yod pas na 'gro kun dang // mya ngan 'das pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and even nirvana are attained.

original: yang de nyid las /🔽chos kun sa bon thams cad pa'i //
analyzed: yang de nyid las / chos kun sa bon thams cad pa'i //
translated: Again, the same text says:

original: rnam par shes pa kun gzhi ste //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun gzhi ste //
translated: The consciousness that is the seed of all phenomena is the foundation consciousness.

original: de bas @3b kun gzhi rnam shes te //🔽dam pa dag la ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de bas @3b kun gzhi rnam shes te // dam pa dag la ngas bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is the foundation consciousness.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: I have explained it to the holy ones.

original: 'di ni re zhig lung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig lung ngo //
translated: This is the scriptural evidence.

original: ci'i phyir de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽skye ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos po der sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na / skye ba can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad 'bras bu'i dngos po der sbyor ba'am /
translated: Why is it called the foundation consciousness?🔽It is the foundation consciousness because all afflicted phenomena are connected to it as the resultant entity,

original: de yang rgyu'i dngos por de dag tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i dngos por de dag tu sbyor ba'i phyir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: or because it is connected to them as the causal entity.

original: yang na sems can dag de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can dag de'i bdag nyid du sbyor bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Or it is the foundation consciousness because sentient beings are connected to it as its self-nature.

original: de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de ni len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the appropriating consciousness.

original: 'di la lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'di la lung ni dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Unraveling the Intent Sūtra says:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle;

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
translated: all seeds spring forth like a flowing river.🔽If I teach it to the childish,

original: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes /🔽'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes / 'di ni byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they will imagine it to be a self.

original: ci'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na /🔽dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa dang / lus can nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya zhe na / dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa dang / lus can nye bar len pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why is it called the appropriating consciousness?🔽It is the cause of all physical sense faculties and it is the support for appropriating a physical body.

original: 'di ltar tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug gi bar du des dbang po gzugs can lnga po dag ma zhig par nye bar bzung ba dang / lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug gi bar du des dbang po gzugs can lnga po dag ma zhig par nye bar bzung ba dang / lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: As long as life lasts, it holds on to the five physical sense faculties without letting them disintegrate, and it is the support for appropriating the entire body.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba na yang de mngon par 'grub pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir lus bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba na yang de mngon par 'grub pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir lus bzung ba yin te /
translated: When it is linked to a new birth, it takes up a body in order to grasp the new birth of the body.

original: de lta bas na de len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the appropriating consciousness.

original: de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sems dang / yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Lord has said, “Mind, thought, and consciousness.”

original: de la yid ni rnam pa gnyis te /🔽de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir /🔽rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gnas dang / gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nyon mongs pa bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa dang /
analyzed: de la yid ni rnam pa gnyis te / de ma thag pa'i rkyen byed pas gnas su gyur pa'i phyir / rnam par shes pa 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa skye ba'i gnas dang / gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid nyon mongs pa bzhi po 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa dang /
translated: Here, thought is twofold:🔽The first is the basis of the arising of consciousness, called the “immediately antecedent condition” because it is the basis for the arising of consciousness.

original: ma rig pa dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: The second is the defiled mind, which is always associated with four defilements: the view of a real self, the conceit “I am,” self-love, and self-ignorance.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas so //
translated: It is the basis of the defilement of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gang gnas gcig pos ni bskyed la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gang gnas gcig pos ni bskyed la /
translated: Consciousness is produced by one basis,

original: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste /🔽yul la rnam par rig pa'i @4a * //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste / yul la rnam par rig pa'i @4a * //
translated: and is defiled by a second.

original: phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is consciousness because it is aware of objects.

original: de ma thag pa dang / ngar sems pa'i phyir yid ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ma thag pa dang / ngar sems pa'i phyir yid ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The mental faculty is twofold: it is the immediately preceding condition for consciousness, and it is the support for the defiled and undefiled states of mind.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de yod par ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid de yod par ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that there is a defiled manas?

original: de med du zin na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, there would be the fault that unmixed ignorance would not exist.

original: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
translated: There would be the fault that the similarity of the five would not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa lnga'i tshogs dag gi lhan cig 'byung ba'i gnas ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the simultaneous support of the five groups of consciousnesses is the eye, etc.

original: nges pa'i tshig med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be the fault that the etymological explanation would not exist.

original: 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bye brag med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bye brag med pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur te /
translated: There would be the fault that the meditative attainment of nonperception and the meditative attainment of cessation would be indistinguishable,

original: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis rab tu phye ba yin gyi /
translated: because the meditative attainment of nonperception is distinguished by the afflicted mind,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but the meditative attainment of cessation is not.

original: gzhan du na 'di gnyis bye brag med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di gnyis bye brag med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, these two would be indistinguishable.

original: gal te 'du shes med pas de na ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med na 'du shes med par skye ba thog thag tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'du shes med pas de na ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med na 'du shes med par skye ba thog thag tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the conception of “I” and the pride that thinks “I am” do not exist in the meditative attainment of nonperception, there would be the fault that the meditative attainment of nonperception would be non-afflicted from beginning to end.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems rnams la yang ngar 'dzin pa dus thams cad du kun tu 'byung bar dmigs pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems rnams la yang ngar 'dzin pa dus thams cad du kun tu 'byung bar dmigs pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is observed that the conception of “I” always occurs in relation to virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral minds.

original: gzhan du na ni mi dge ba'i sems kho na dang de mtshungs par ldan pas nga'o snyam pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung gi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni mi dge ba'i sems kho na dang de mtshungs par ldan pas nga'o snyam pa'i nyon mongs pa kun tu 'byung gi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, the afflicted view of the self would occur only in association with a nonvirtuous mind, and not in association with a virtuous or neutral mind.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung bar kun tu 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan par kun tu 'byung bas skyon 'di dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung bar kun tu 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan par kun tu 'byung bas skyon 'di dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the error does not occur because the afflicted view of the self occurs in two ways: it occurs simultaneously with the mind and it occurs in association with the mind.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:🔽The error would be that there would be no unmixed ignorance,

original: ma 'dres pa yi ma rig dang // lnga po dag dang 'dra ba dang // snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang // nges tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yi ma rig dang // lnga po dag dang 'dra ba dang // snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang // nges tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
translated: no similarity with the five, no distinction of meditative development, and no etymological definition.

original: 'du shes med pa'i skye ba'i rgyun //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i skye ba'i rgyun //
translated: The error would be that there would be no life-stream of the nonpercipient beings.

original: ngar 'dzin med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //🔽ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin med pa'i skyon du 'gyur // ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni //
translated: The error would be that there would be no self-grasping.🔽It is not tenable that self-grasping

original: rnam pa kun tu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu mi 'thad do //
translated: exists in any way.

original: nyon mongs can gyi yid med na //
analyzed: nyon mongs can gyi yid med na //
translated: If there were no afflicted mind,

original: gnyis med gsum po 'gal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis med gsum po 'gal bar 'gyur //
translated: the three non-associated with the two would be contradictory.

original: de med na ni ngar 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de med na ni ngar 'dzin pa //
translated: If that did not exist, self-grasping

original: kun na yod par mi 'gyur ro //🔽yang dag don la 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: kun na yod par mi 'gyur ro // yang dag don la 'jug pa yi //
translated: It would not exist everywhere.🔽It is the constant obstruction of the mind🔽that engages the meaning of reality,

original: sems kyi bgegs su rtag 'gyur dang // dus rnams kun tu 'byung ba de //
analyzed: sems kyi bgegs su rtag 'gyur dang // dus rnams kun tu 'byung ba de //
translated: and it occurs at all times.

original: ma 'dres pa yi ma rig 'dod //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa yi ma rig 'dod //
translated: It is asserted to be the unmixed ignorance.

original: @4b yid ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
analyzed: @4b yid ni nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ste /
translated: Because the mental consciousness is defiled, it is obscured and indeterminate.

original: sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi dang rtag tu mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is always associated with the four kinds of defilements that are obstructions.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du 'di ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du 'di ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa nyid do //
translated: Like the passions associated with the realms of form and of the formless, it is obscured and indeterminate.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid ni zhi gnas kyis khyad pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yid ni zhi gnas kyis khyad pa yin la /
translated: The mental consciousness associated with the realms of form and of the formless is distinguished by its calm and insight.

original: yid ni dus thams cad du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ni dus thams cad du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental consciousness is always associated with these four passions.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par sems kyi lus gsum pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par sems kyi lus gsum pa mi dmigs te /
translated: Apart from the store consciousness, a third kind of mind is not perceived in the two other kinds of realms.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems nyid yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems nyid yin par grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is established that the store consciousness is mind.

original: sa bon thams cad pa de las yid dang rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa de las yid dang rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that seed of everything, mind and consciousness arise.

original: de yang ci'i phyir sems zhes kyang bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir sems zhes kyang bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called mind?

original: chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon sna tshogs rnams kyis kun tu bstsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bag chags kyi sa bon sna tshogs rnams kyis kun tu bstsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the accumulation of various seeds of the impregnations of habitual tendencies of the dharmas.

original: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg par sems de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar ram ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg par sems de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar ram ;
translated: Why is that mind not taught in the Śrāvaka Vehicle as the all-base consciousness

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar ma bstan zhe na /
translated: or as the appropriating consciousness?

original: shes bya phra mo bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes bya phra mo bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a subtle object of knowledge.

original: nyan thos rnams ni shes bya thams cad lhag par shes pa la gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni shes bya thams cad lhag par shes pa la gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas are not concerned with the knowledge of all objects of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni de bstan pa med par yang shes par rab tu grub pas rnam par grol ba rab tu grub pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni de bstan pa med par yang shes par rab tu grub pas rnam par grol ba rab tu grub pa'i phyir ma bstan to //
translated: Therefore, even without teaching that, they are established in knowledge, and thus liberation is established, so it is not taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes bya thams cad lhag par shes pa la gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes bya thams cad lhag par shes pa la gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas are concerned with the knowledge of all objects of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de dag la de bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la de bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha taught the all-base to them.

original: de shes pa med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de shes pa med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: Without knowing the all-base, it is not easy to attain the wisdom of omniscience.

original: yang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan te /
analyzed: yang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan te /
translated: The all-base consciousness was also taught in the Hearer Vehicle, but in a provisional sense.

original: gcig las 'phros pa'i lung de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i mdo las /
analyzed: gcig las 'phros pa'i lung de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i mdo las /
translated: The Sūtra on the Benefits of the Appearance of a Tathāgata, which is an extension of the Ekottarikāgama, says:

original: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba /
analyzed: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba /
translated: All beings delight in the all-base,

original: kun gzhi las yang dag par byung ba kun gzhi la mngon par dga' ba can dag la kun gzhi spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun gzhi las yang dag par byung ba kun gzhi la mngon par dga' ba can dag la kun gzhi spang ba'i phyir /
translated: and they delight in the all-base that arises from the all-base.

original: chos bstan na nyan 'dod la /
analyzed: chos bstan na nyan 'dod la /
translated: If the Dharma is taught in order to abandon the all-base,

original: rna ba gtod de /
analyzed: rna ba gtod de /
translated: they wish to hear it and they focus their ears.

original: kun shes par byed par sems nye bar 'jog cing chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub ste /
analyzed: kun shes par byed par sems nye bar 'jog cing chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub ste /
translated: They set their minds on understanding and practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos 'di yang 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes ji skad @5a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos 'di yang 'jig rten du 'byung ngo zhes ji skad @5a * //
translated: When a tathāgata appears in the world, this Dharma, which is a wonder and marvel, also appears in the world.

original: gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rnam grangs 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this method, the foundation consciousness is taught in the śrāvaka vehicle.

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde'i lung las kyang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde'i lung las kyang rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the scriptures of the Mahāsāṃghika, it is called the root consciousness.

original: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
translated: By this method, it is also taught.

original: rtsa ba de la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba de la brten pa'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a tree that is rooted in the ground.

original: sa ston gyi sde'i lung las kyang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po rnams zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sa ston gyi sde'i lung las kyang 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po rnams zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the scriptures of the Mahīśāsaka, it is called the aggregates that last as long as saṃsāra.

original: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
analyzed: rnam grangs des kyang de nyid bstan te /
translated: By this method, it is also taught.

original: la lar res 'ga' gzugs dang sems rgyun chad par snang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la lar res 'ga' gzugs dang sems rgyun chad par snang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In some places, the continuum of form and mind is sometimes interrupted, but the seeds of those are uninterrupted in the foundation consciousness.

original: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa rnams kyi lung las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa gnas brtan pa rnams kyi lung las kyang /
translated: In the scriptures of the noble Sthaviras, it is called the container consciousness.

original: srid pa'i yan lag lta ba dang // shes pa dang ni gtong ba dang // g-yo ba dang ni rtogs pa dang / bdun pa 'jug par byed pa yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag lta ba dang // shes pa dang ni gtong ba dang // g-yo ba dang ni rtogs pa dang / bdun pa 'jug par byed pa yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: movement, realization, and engagement.

original: de'i phyir gang shes bya'i gnas la len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid dang / sems nyid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid dang / 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po dang / srid pa'i yan lag tu bstan pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang shes bya'i gnas la len pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid dang / sems nyid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa nyid dang / 'khor ba ji srid pa'i phung po dang / srid pa'i yan lag tu bstan pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the appropriating consciousness itself, the mind itself, the storehouse consciousness itself, the root consciousness itself, the aggregates that last as long as cyclic existence, and the members of existence that are taught are the storehouse consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam chen po btod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam chen po btod pa kho na yin no //
translated: The great path of the storehouse consciousness is opened up.

original: kha cig 'di snyam du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: kha cig 'di snyam du sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni don gcig kho na ste /
translated: Some think that mind, thought, and consciousness are just one thing,

original: 'dir tshig 'bru tha dad do snyam du sems pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'dir tshig 'bru tha dad do snyam du sems pa de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: but have different words. That is not tenable.

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because mind and consciousness are perceived as having different meanings.

original: de'i phyir sems kyang don tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyang don tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, mind and consciousness are different.🔽Some think that the five appropriated aggregates are the foundation consciousness, because the Bhagavān said:

original: yang kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: yang kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kyis skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes rgya cher gang gsungs pa de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o snyam du sems so //
translated: All beings delight in the foundation consciousness.

original: gzhan dag ni bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni kun gzhi'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni kun gzhi'o snyam du sems so //
translated: Others think that the feeling of pleasure associated with attachment is the foundation consciousness.

original: gzhan dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun gzhi'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun gzhi'o snyam du sems te /
translated: Others think that the view of the transitory collection is the foundation consciousness.

original: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs nas lung dang rtogs pas de snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs nas lung dang rtogs pas de snyam du sems so //
translated: These people, confused about foundation consciousness, think that way because of scripture and reasoning.

original: nyan thos kyi theg par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du na yang de dag gi rnam par @5b gzhag pa de mi rung ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du na yang de dag gi rnam par @5b gzhag pa de mi rung ba med mod kyi /
translated: Even in the way things are presented in the Śrāvaka Vehicle, their presentation is not incorrect.

original: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyis kun gzhi rnam par gzhag pa de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa ni ches bzang ngo //
analyzed: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyis kun gzhi rnam par gzhag pa de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa ni ches bzang ngo //
translated: Those who are not confused about this should posit the foundation consciousness as the foundation consciousness, not as the foundation consciousness.

original: ji ltar ches bzang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ches bzang zhe na /
translated: Why is it better?

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro rnams su skyes pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro rnams su skyes pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Because the five appropriated aggregates are incompatible with those born in the miserable realms of suffering.

original: des ni shin tu 'dod pa med pa de dag la sbyor ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: des ni shin tu 'dod pa med pa de dag la sbyor ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to connect them with those who do not desire them at all.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni de dang ni de dang 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni de dang ni de dang 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Because they desire to be free from them.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma la med de /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma la med de /
translated: Also, the feeling of pleasure that is associated with attachment does not exist above the fourth absorption.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pas der yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa yin pas der yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so //
translated: Because it is incompatible with sentient beings who possess it, it is not reasonable to connect them there.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang chos 'di pa bdag med pa la mos pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba yang chos 'di pa bdag med pa la mos pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates is also incompatible with the belief in the selflessness of this dharma.

original: de'i phyir de la yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to apply it to that.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba rnams su skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par zhig par 'dod kyang /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba rnams su skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par zhig par 'dod kyang /
translated: Those who accept the foundation consciousness as an internal self-entity are born in very miserable realms and desire the destruction of the mass of suffering.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pas bcings pa rnams de rnam par zhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pas bcings pa rnams de rnam par zhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But those who are bound by attachment to the foundation consciousness as a self never desire its destruction.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong mar skyes pa rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por chags pa'i rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong mar skyes pa rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por chags pa'i rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: Those born in the higher realms above the fourth absorption, although they are not in accord with the happiness of those with attachment, still have a connection with attachment to the foundation consciousness as a self-entity.

original: de bzhin du chos 'di bdag med pa la mos pa rnams bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por chags pa'i rjes su 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos 'di bdag med pa la mos pa rnams bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag gi dngos por chags pa'i rjes su 'brel pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Likewise, although those who believe in the selflessness of this teaching are not in accord with the view of self, they still have a connection with the attachment to the reality of self in the foundation consciousness.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the foundation consciousness as the foundation itself is well established.

original: 'di ni re zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the synonyms of the foundation consciousness.

original: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of its characteristics?

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, it is threefold:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of its own characteristics, the presentation of its causality, and the presentation of its effects.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan @6a * //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gi mtshan @6a * //
translated: The presentation of its own characteristics

original: nyid ni / gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas /
analyzed: nyid ni / gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas /
translated: The “itself” is that which, based on the habitual tendencies of all afflicted phenomena,🔽

original: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas /
translated: The nature of the alaya is that it is the cause of all the afflicted phenomena because it holds the seeds of all the afflicted phenomena.

original: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the cause of their arising.

original: de la rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gis bon thams cad pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de nyid kyi rgyu nyid du dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa yin no //🔽de la 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de la rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rang gis bon thams cad pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de nyid kyi rgyu nyid du dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa yin no // de la 'bras bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa nyid ni /
translated: The nature of the cause is that the alaya consciousness, which is the seed of all phenomena, always exists as the cause of those afflicted phenomena.

original: gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags la brten nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi thog ma med pa'i dus kyi bag chags la brten nas byung ba'o //
translated: The alaya is posited as the result of the afflicted phenomena because it arises in dependence on the beginningless habitual tendencies of those afflicted phenomena.🔽What is a habitual tendency?

original: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / bag chags zhes brjod pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / bag chags zhes brjod pa 'di'i brjod par bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term habitual tendency?

original: chos de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa la brten nas de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos de dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa la brten nas de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: That which is to be expressed is the reason for the arising of that which arises simultaneously with that phenomenon and that which arises in dependence on its cessation.🔽For example, sesame seeds are infused with the scent of flowers when they arise and cease simultaneously with the flowers, and the sesame seeds become the reason for the arising of that scent.

original: dper na ti la dag la me tog gis bsgos pa til dang me tog lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang til rnams de'i dri gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang sems ni de'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: dper na ti la dag la me tog gis bsgos pa til dang me tog lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang til rnams de'i dri gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang sems ni de'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba dang /
translated: Also, the latent potentialities of attachment and so on arise simultaneously with attachment and so on in those who engage in attachment and so on, and the mind becomes the reason for that.

original: mang du thos pa rnams kyi mang du thos pa'i bag chags kyang thos pa de yid la byed pa dang lhan cig tu 'byung zhing 'gags kyang sems ni de brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ste /
analyzed: mang du thos pa rnams kyi mang du thos pa'i bag chags kyang thos pa de yid la byed pa dang lhan cig tu 'byung zhing 'gags kyang sems ni de brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ste /
translated: Also, the latent potentialities of those who have heard a lot arise simultaneously with the mental attention of hearing a lot, and the mind becomes the reason for the expression of that.

original: bag chags des yongs su zin par chos 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags des yongs su zin par chos 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “grasping at dharmas that is governed by those propensities” should be understood in the same way as the storehouse consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon de dag ci so so tha dad dam /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi sa bon de dag ci so so tha dad dam /
translated: Are the seeds of those dharmas that are afflicted in the storehouse consciousness separate from it?

original: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin par gnas she na /🔽de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa ma yin par gnas she na / de la gnas pa de dag dang rdzas su tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: Or, do they exist in a non-separate way?

original: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: The seeds that exist in the storehouse consciousness are neither substantially separate from it nor non-separate from it.

original: gang de 'byung ba'i mthu'i khyad par can kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de /
analyzed: gang de 'byung ba'i mthu'i khyad par can kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de /
translated: The storehouse consciousness that has the special power to produce them

original: de bzhin du byung ba la sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de bzhin du byung ba la sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya'o /
translated: is said to be “endowed with all the seeds.”

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu @6b nyid du gcig 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu @6b nyid du gcig 'gyur bar ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should one view the simultaneous relationship of the storehouse consciousness and those afflicted dharmas as cause and effect?

original: dper na mar me'i me lce 'byung ba dang / snying po tshig pa phan tshun dus mnyam pa dang / mdung khyim yang dus mnyam du gcig la brten nas mi 'gyel ba de bzhin du 'dir yang gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar blta'o //
analyzed: dper na mar me'i me lce 'byung ba dang / snying po tshig pa phan tshun dus mnyam pa dang / mdung khyim yang dus mnyam du gcig la brten nas mi 'gyel ba de bzhin du 'dir yang gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bar blta'o //
translated: For example, the flame of a lamp and the burning of its wick are simultaneous, and a trident does not fall as long as it rests on two points.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis rgyu yin pa de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyis rgyu yin pa de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i rkyen nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Just as the ālaya consciousness is the cause of all afflicted phenomena, so too all afflicted phenomena are posited as the causal condition of the ālaya consciousness,

original: rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no other cause is observed.

original: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing sna tshogs ma yin pa chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gis rgyur ci ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhing sna tshogs ma yin pa chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gis rgyur ci ltar rung zhe na /
translated: How can a nondistinct and nondiverse latent impression be the cause of distinct and diverse phenomena?

original: dper na tshig gu'i rtsi sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba'i ras sna tshogs su mi snang ba gang gi tshe tshon gyi snod du bcug pa de'i tshe ras la tshon rnams kyi dbye ba tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma ston pa de bzhin du ;
analyzed: dper na tshig gu'i rtsi sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba'i ras sna tshogs su mi snang ba gang gi tshe tshon gyi snod du bcug pa de'i tshe ras la tshon rnams kyi dbye ba tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs du ma ston pa de bzhin du ;
translated: For example, a cloth that is dyed with various colors does not appear as various colors when it is in the dye-vat, but when it is taken out of the dye-vat, it displays various colors in various patterns.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags sna tshogs kyis bsgos pa yang bag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs ma yin yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshon gyi snod du mngon par phyogs na chos sna tshogs tshad med pa dag ston te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags sna tshogs kyis bsgos pa yang bag chags kyi dus na sna tshogs ma yin yang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshon gyi snod du mngon par phyogs na chos sna tshogs tshad med pa dag ston te /
translated: In the same way, the consciousness of the ground-of-all, which is infused with various habitual tendencies, is not various at the time of the habitual tendencies, but when it is turned toward the dye-vat of the results, it displays immeasurable various phenomena.

original: 'di ni theg pa chen po la phra ba mchog tu zab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa chen po la phra ba mchog tu zab pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the subtle, supreme, and profound dependent origination in the Great Vehicle.

original: mdor bsdu na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of dependent origination:

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can dang / sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can no //
translated: that which distinguishes natures and that which distinguishes the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: de la gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten nas chos rnams 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can te /
analyzed: de la gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten nas chos rnams 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can te /
translated: That which arises in dependence on the storehouse consciousness is the differentiation of essences.

original: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs rnam par 'byed pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid sna tshogs rnam par 'byed pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the condition for the differentiation of various essences.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang yin pa de ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang yin pa de ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can te /
translated: That which is the twelve members of dependent origination is the differentiation of the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i lus rnam par dbye ba sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs pa dag kha cig ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog / kha cig ni sngon byas @7a * //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i lus rnam par dbye ba sna tshogs kyi rkyen gyi dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs pa dag kha cig ni rang bzhin gyi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog / kha cig ni sngon byas @7a * //
translated: It is the condition for the differentiation of the various pleasant and unpleasant bodies in good and bad destinies.🔽Among them, some who are confused about the first dependent origination, the storehouse consciousness, imagine that it arises from a natural cause,

original: pa nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
analyzed: pa nyid kyi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
translated: while others imagine that it arises from a cause that was previously created.

original: kha cig ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
analyzed: kha cig ni dbang phyug gis sprul pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
translated: Some imagine that it arises from a cause that is emanated by Īśvara.

original: kha cig ni bdag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid du rtog /
translated: Some imagine that it arises from a cause that is the self.

original: kha cig ni rgyu med pa dang / rkyen med pa nyid du rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu med pa dang / rkyen med pa nyid du rtog go //
translated: Some imagine that it arises without a cause and without conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la rmongs pa dag ni bdag la byed pa po dang za ba por rtog ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la rmongs pa dag ni bdag la byed pa po dang za ba por rtog ste /
translated: Those who are confused about the second dependent origination imagine that the self is the agent and the experiencer.

original: dper na mi dmus long mang zhig yod la /
analyzed: dper na mi dmus long mang zhig yod la /
translated: For example, there are many blind people.

original: de dag kyang glang po che ma mthong ba sha stag cig ste /🔽de dag la la la zhig gis glang po che bstan la /
analyzed: de dag kyang glang po che ma mthong ba sha stag cig ste / de dag la la la zhig gis glang po che bstan la /
translated: Moreover, they are all people who have never seen an elephant.🔽One of them shows an elephant to those blind people.

original: de dag las kha cig gis ni glang po che de'i sna la reg /🔽kha cig gis ni mche ba la reg /
analyzed: de dag las kha cig gis ni glang po che de'i sna la reg / kha cig gis ni mche ba la reg /
translated: Some of them touch the elephant’s trunk,🔽some touch its tusk,

original: kha cig gis ni rna ba la reg /🔽kha cig gis ni rkang pa la reg /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rna ba la reg / kha cig gis ni rkang pa la reg /
translated: some touch its ear,🔽some touch its leg,

original: kha cig gis ni mjug ma la reg /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mjug ma la reg /
translated: and some touch its tail.

original: kha cig gis ni sgal tshigs la reg la de dag la glang po che ci 'dra zhes dris pa dang / kha cig na re gshol mda' lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sgal tshigs la reg la de dag la glang po che ci 'dra zhes dris pa dang / kha cig na re gshol mda' lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
translated: Some touched the elephant's back and said it was like a winnowing fan.

original: kha cig na re gtun shing lta bu zhig go zhes zer /🔽kha cig na re zhib ma lta bu zhig go zhes zer /🔽kha cig na re gtun gyi gzhi lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re gtun shing lta bu zhig go zhes zer / kha cig na re zhib ma lta bu zhig go zhes zer / kha cig na re gtun gyi gzhi lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
translated: Some touched the elephant's tail and said it was like a pestle.🔽Some touched the elephant's flank and said it was like a storeroom.

original: kha cig na re phyags ma lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re phyags ma lta bu zhig go zhes zer /
translated: Some touched the elephant's leg and said it was like a pillar.

original: kha cig na re pha bong lta bu zhig go zhes zer ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: kha cig na re pha bong lta bu zhig go zhes zer ba de bzhin du /
translated: Some touched the elephant's trunk and said it was like a plow.

original: 'di na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa gnyes po 'di mi shes pa ma rig pas dmus long bzhin du gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa gnyes po 'di mi shes pa ma rig pas dmus long bzhin du gyur pa /
translated: In the same way, those who do not understand the two kinds of dependent origination, who are like the blind,

original: glang po che lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa dag kyang /
analyzed: glang po che lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu mi shes pa dag kyang /
translated: do not understand the nature of the foundation consciousness, which is like the elephant, nor do they understand its causes and effects.

original: kha cig ni rang bzhin rgyu nyid du sems /
analyzed: kha cig ni rang bzhin rgyu nyid du sems /
translated: Some think that its nature is its cause.

original: kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar sems /🔽kha cig ni dbang phyug yod par sems /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung bar sems / kha cig ni dbang phyug yod par sems /
translated: Some think that it arises from a cause created in the past.🔽Some think that it arises from the existence of a creator.

original: kha cig ni bdag yod par sems /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag yod par sems /
translated: Some think that it arises from the existence of a self.

original: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar sems /🔽kha cig ni byed pa por sems /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar sems / kha cig ni byed pa por sems /
translated: Some think that it arises without a cause.🔽Some think that it arises from a maker.

original: kha cig ni za ba por sems so //
analyzed: kha cig ni za ba por sems so //
translated: Some think that it arises from an experiencer.

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa ste /
translated: In brief, the essence of the store consciousness is the result of evolution, the store consciousness that contains all the seeds.

original: des khams gsum pa'i lus thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: des khams gsum pa'i lus thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsdus so //
translated: It includes all bodies in the three realms and all reincarnating beings.🔽Here is a verse:

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyi dang nang dang mi gsal ba //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa phyi dang nang dang mi gsal ba //
translated: External, internal, and unclear,🔽dual, and conventional,

original: gnyis dang kun rdzob nyid dang ni //🔽dam pa'i don te de dag kun //
analyzed: gnyis dang kun rdzob nyid dang ni // dam pa'i don te de dag kun //
translated: and also ultimate:

original: sa bon rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: sa bon rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: all these are considered to be the six kinds of seeds.

original: skad @7b cig pa dang lhan cig byung //
analyzed: skad @7b cig pa dang lhan cig byung //
translated: They are momentary and simultaneous,

original: de ni rgyun chags 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: and are considered to be a continuous series.

original: nges dang rkyen la ltos pa dang // rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: nges dang rkyen la ltos pa dang // rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: and is established by its own effect.

original: brten lung ma bstan bsgo bya ba //🔽sgo bar byed dang 'brel pa la //
analyzed: brten lung ma bstan bsgo bya ba // sgo bar byed dang 'brel pa la //
translated: It is neutral, to be eliminated by cultivation,🔽and is related to the controller.🔽The controller is related to it,

original: sgo byed de las gzhan ni min //
analyzed: sgo byed de las gzhan ni min //
translated: but not to anything else.

original: de ni bag chags mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni bag chags mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the instinct.

original: drug po dag la 'brel med de //
analyzed: drug po dag la 'brel med de //
translated: It is not related to the six,

original: tha dad gsum dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: tha dad gsum dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
translated: because it is related to the three differences.

original: skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no momentariness or simultaneity.

original: rigs la bya na gzhan du thal //
analyzed: rigs la bya na gzhan du thal //
translated: If it is said to be a type, it follows that it is different.

original: phyi dang nang gi sa bon de //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi sa bon de //
translated: The external and internal seeds

original: bskyed pa dang ni 'phen par 'dod //
analyzed: bskyed pa dang ni 'phen par 'dod //
translated: are considered to be the projecting and producing causes.

original: ma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the dead do not project,

original: mda' ni bar du mi ltung bzhin //
analyzed: mda' ni bar du mi ltung bzhin //
translated: like an arrow shot by an archer.

original: phyir rol gyi sa bon ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi rnams kyi sa bon nyid ni de lta ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: phyir rol gyi sa bon ji lta ba bzhin du nang gi rnams kyi sa bon nyid ni de lta ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The internal seeds are not like the external seeds. A verse on this:

original: phyi rol sa bon ma btab bam //
analyzed: phyi rol sa bon ma btab bam //
translated: The external seeds are not planted

original: nang gi 'dod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: nang gi 'dod pa ma yin te //
translated: because the internal ones are not desired.

original: thos sogs bag chags med na ni //
analyzed: thos sogs bag chags med na ni //
translated: If there were no instinct for hearing, etc.,

original: de 'bras skye ba mi rigs phyir //
analyzed: de 'bras skye ba mi rigs phyir //
translated: it would be unreasonable for the result to arise.

original: byas dang ma byas 'jigs dang phrad //
analyzed: byas dang ma byas 'jigs dang phrad //
translated: One is afraid of what one has done and what one has not done.

original: nyes par 'gyur bas 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par 'gyur bas 'gal phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of contradiction.

original: nang ni phyi rol rkyen yin te //
analyzed: nang ni phyi rol rkyen yin te //
translated: The internal is the external condition,

original: 'di ltar de ni bag chags rten //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bag chags rten //
translated: because it is the basis of the latent impressions.

original: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta ste /
analyzed: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus dang 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta ste /
translated: Moreover, the other form of the alaya consciousness is the one that is active, and it should be understood as being associated with the body and all the stages of life.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: The Verses that Distinguish the Middle from the Extremes states:

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: One is the consciousness that is a condition;

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
translated: the second is the one that is active.🔽The active one and the one that discriminates,

original: nye bar spyod dang yongs gcod dang / de yi 'jug byed sems las byung //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod dang yongs gcod dang / de yi 'jug byed sems las byung // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the mental factors that cause them to engage.

original: rnam par shes pa de gnyis ni gcig gi rkyen gcig yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de gnyis ni gcig gi rkyen gcig yin te /
translated: These two forms of consciousness are mutually conditioning.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Abhidharma Sūtra states:

original: chos kun rnam par shes la sbyor //
analyzed: chos kun rnam par shes la sbyor //
translated: All phenomena are associated with consciousness,

original: de dag la yang de de bzhin //
analyzed: de dag la yang de de bzhin //
translated: and they are also like that.

original: phan tshun 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // rgyu yi dngos por rtag tu sbyor //
analyzed: phan tshun 'bras bu'i dngos po dang // rgyu yi dngos por rtag tu sbyor //
translated: They are always connected to each other as cause and effect.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs so //
translated: This is the verse.

original: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag phan du rgyu'i rkyen yin na /
analyzed: gal te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la rnam par shes pa de dag phan du rgyu'i rkyen yin na /
translated: If the first dependent origination is the condition of the cause of those consciousnesses,

original: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la gang gi rkyen zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gnyis pa la gang gi rkyen zhes bya zhe na /
translated: then in the second dependent origination, what is called the condition?

original: bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: It is the dominant condition.

original: yang rnam par shes pa drug po dag rkyen du zhig gis skye zhe na /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa drug po dag rkyen du zhig gis skye zhe na /
translated: Again, by how many conditions are the six consciousnesses produced?

original: bdag po dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnams kyis skye'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par @8a * //
analyzed: bdag po dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen rnams kyis skye'o // rten cing 'brel par @8a * //
translated: They are produced by the dominant, objective, and immediately antecedent conditions.

original: 'byung ba rnam pa gsum po 'khor ba pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / nye bar spyod pa can gyi rkyen ni bzhi po 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnam pa gsum po 'khor ba pa dang / 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba pa dang / nye bar spyod pa can gyi rkyen ni bzhi po 'di dag yin no //
translated: The three kinds of dependent origination are: the dependent origination of cyclic existence, the dependent origination of the desired and undesired destinies, and the dependent origination of experience. These four conditions are the conditions for those.

original: 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rnam grangs dang mtshan nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the store-consciousness by way of synonyms and characteristics.

original: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam grangs 'di dag gis bstan pa dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang bstan pa ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin par de cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid rnam grangs 'di dag gis bstan pa dang / de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang bstan pa ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin par de cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the evolving consciousnesses are not taught by these synonyms and characteristics in the same way that the store-consciousness is?

original: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med par /
translated: If there were no store-consciousness established in this way,

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba mi rung ste /
translated: then defilement and purification would be impossible.
