original: yul gyi rnam par rig pa dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par rig pa dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: the representation of the object, the representation of verbalization, the representation of the distinction between self and other, and the representation of good and bad destinies, death and rebirth.

original: de la lus dang lus can dang zab po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la lus dang lus can dang zab po'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang / de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The representation of the body, the embodied one, and the enjoyer, the representation of what is enjoyed by it, and the representation of the enjoyment of that.

original: dus dang / grangs dang / yul dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon pa brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang / grangs dang / yul dang / tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon pa brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The representation of time, number, place, and verbalization arises from the seed of the vāsanā of grammar.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The representation of the distinction between self and other arises from the seed of the vāsanā of the view of self.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba'i rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The consciousness of good and bad destinies, of death and rebirth,

original: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung @13b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi sa bon las byung @13b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: arises from the seed of the instinct for the members of becoming.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyis khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas thams cad bsdus pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyis khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas thams cad bsdus pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these consciousnesses all realms, destinies, and places of birth are included. Thus the imagined reality, which is the other-dependent reality, is taught.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas bsdus pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor ba'i don snang ba'i gnas gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pas bsdus pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / nor ba'i don snang ba'i gnas gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The other-dependent reality is that which is the basis for the appearance of the unreal, the existence of the mere representation of consciousness, which is included in the imagined reality, and which is the unreal object.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the imagined reality?

original: gang don med kyang rnam par rig pa tsam de don nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: gang don med kyang rnam par rig pa tsam de don nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance as an unreal object, even though it is only the representation of consciousness.

original: de la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the fulfilled?

original: gang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid la don gyi mtshan nyid de gtan med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de nyid la don gyi mtshan nyid de gtan med pa nyid do //
translated: It is the non-existence of the very characteristic of the relative as an object.

original: de la lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa nang gi khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa nang gi khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness of the body, the embodied being, and the experiencer should be known as the six inner components, the eye, etc.

original: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness of the object experienced should be known as the six outer components, form, etc.

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i khams drug tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness of the experience should be known as the six components, the eye-consciousness, etc.

original: rnam par rig pa lhag ma rnams ni rnam par rig pa 'di dag gi rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa lhag ma rnams ni rnam par rig pa 'di dag gi rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining consciousnesses should be known as the divisions of these consciousnesses.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni don med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di la dpe ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag ni don med pa'i phyir rnam par rig pa tsam mo zhes bya ba 'di la dpe ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the example of the statement, “These consciousnesses are mere representation because of the non-existence of the object”?

original: rmi lam la sogs pa ni dper blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa ni dper blta bar bya'o //
translated: Dreams, etc., are to be regarded as examples.

original: dper na rmi lam na don med par yang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / khang khyim dang / nags tshal dang / sa dang ri la sogs pa'i don sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang gi de na don ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam na don med par yang rnam par shes pa tsam nyid du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / khang khyim dang / nags tshal dang / sa dang ri la sogs pa'i don sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang gi de na don ni ci yang med do //
translated: For example, in a dream, consciousness alone appears as various objects, such as forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, houses, forests, lands, mountains, etc., even though those objects do not exist.

original: dpe 'dis ni thams cad du yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe 'dis ni thams cad du yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By this example, one should understand that in all cases, there is only representation.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rab rib rnams dper rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba smos pas ni sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rab rib rnams dper rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes illusions, mirages, and visual distortions as examples.

original: gal te rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du sad pa na yang thams cad du yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du zad na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du sad pa na yang thams cad du yang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du zad na /
translated: If, like in a dream, everything is only representation in the waking state as well,

original: dper na rmi lam la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi blo 'byung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid kyi blo 'byung ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: why doesn’t the thought “This is only representation” occur in the waking state, just as it does in a dream?

original: de kho na shes pas sad pa rnams la 'byung ste /🔽dper na rmi lam rmi zhing ma sad pa la mi 'byung gi sad pa @14a * //
analyzed: de kho na shes pas sad pa rnams la 'byung ste / dper na rmi lam rmi zhing ma sad pa la mi 'byung gi sad pa @14a * //
translated: It occurs to those who are awakened by knowing reality.

original: la 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: la 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, it does not occur to those who are dreaming and not awakened, but it does occur to those who are awakened.

original: de kho na shes pas ma sad pa la mi 'byung gi de kho na shes pas sad pa la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de kho na shes pas ma sad pa la mi 'byung gi de kho na shes pas sad pa la 'byung ngo //
translated: Similarly, it does not occur to those who are not awakened by knowing reality, but it does occur to those who are awakened by knowing reality.

original: de kho na shes pas ma sad pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du ji ltar rjes su dpag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na shes pas ma sad pas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du ji ltar rjes su dpag par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it inferred that those who are not awakened by knowing reality are aware only of representations?

original: lung dang rigs pas dpag par bya ste /
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas dpag par bya ste /
translated: It is inferred through scripture and reasoning.

original: de la lung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa bcu ba las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa bcu ba las 'di lta ste /
translated: As for scripture, the Bhagavat said in the Dashabhumika Sutra:🔽“This triple world is mind only.”

original: khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las byang chub sems dpa' byams pas zhus nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa lta bu ste /
translated: And in the Samdhinirmocana Sutra, the Bhagavat said this in response to a question by the bodhisattva Maitreya:🔽“Maitreya, form is also like that.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de ci sems de las tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de ci sems de las tha dad pa zhes bgyi'am tha dad pa ma lags zhes bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, is the reflection that is the object of concentration different from that mind or not different?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa tha dad pa ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Maitreya, it is not different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can yin no zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained that consciousness is distinguished by the mere awareness of an object.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de gal te sems las tha dad pa ma lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de gal te sems las tha dad pa ma lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if the reflection that is the object of concentration is not different from the mind,

original: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid ji ltar 'dzin pa lags /
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis sems de nyid ji ltar 'dzin pa lags /
translated: how does that very mind apprehend that very mind?

original: byams pa chos gang yang chos gang la yang mi 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: byams pa chos gang yang chos gang la yang mi 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: Maitreya, no dharma whatsoever apprehends any dharma at all.

original: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni de ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar skyes pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni de ltar snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, the mind that arises in that way appears in that way.

original: dper na gzugs kyis rkyen byas te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyis rkyen byas te /
translated: For example, form acts as a condition

original: gzugs nyid mthong yang /
analyzed: gzugs nyid mthong yang /
translated: and form itself is seen.

original: gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems te /
translated: The mind thinks, “I see a reflection.”

original: de la ni gzugs de dang gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs de dang gzugs brnyan snang ba de don tha dad par snang ngo //
translated: In that case, the form and the appearance of the reflection appear as different objects.

original: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de yang de las don tha dad par snang ngo zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar skyes pa'i sems de yang de las don tha dad par snang ngo zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the mind that has arisen in that way appears as a different object from that.

original: lung 'dis rigs pa yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung 'dis rigs pa yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: This scripture also teaches the reasoning.

original: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa na shes bya'i gzugs brnyan rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de nyid sems mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa na shes bya'i gzugs brnyan rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa gang dang gang mthong ba de dang de nyid sems mthong ba ste /
translated: Thus, when the mind is in equipoise, whatever image of an object of knowledge is seen, such as a corpse in various stages of decomposition, that is the mind that sees that.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa don gzhan med do //
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa don gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other object, such as a corpse, that is different from it.

original: rigs pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig pa thams cad la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rjes su dpag par bya bar 'os so //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig pa thams cad la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rjes su dpag par bya bar 'os so //
translated: By this reasoning, it is suitable for bodhisattvas to infer that all consciousnesses are only consciousness.

original: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: Also, it is not suitable for a memory consciousness to arise with respect to a corpse in various stages of decomposition.

original: dmigs pa de mdun du bzhag na snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa de mdun du bzhag na snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when that object is placed in front of them, it appears.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba @14b la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang 'das pa la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba @14b la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de yang 'das pa la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: And the memory consciousness that arises from hearing and reflection also has the appearance of that object, because it has the past as its object.

original: der snang ba rnam par rig pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der snang ba rnam par rig pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is a mere representation.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' de kho na shes pas ma sad pas kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'dis byang chub sems dpa' de kho na shes pas ma sad pas kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: By this inference, the bodhisattva who is not yet awakened by the knowledge of reality should infer mere representation.

original: gang rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par rig pa sna tshogs bstan pa de dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs na /
analyzed: gang rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par rig pa sna tshogs bstan pa de dag las mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs na /
translated: If the various representations that are taught are like a dream, then it is reasonable that the representations of eye consciousness and so on are mere representations.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du blta zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du blta zhe na /
translated: But how should the physical representations of eye consciousness and so on be viewed as mere representations?

original: de dag kyang lung dang rigs pas blta bar bya ste /

analyzed: gal te de dag kyang rnam par rig pa tsam nyid yin na /

analyzed: de med du zin na nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ro //

original: de med du zin na rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med du zin na rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur te /

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /

original: rnam par rig pa med na ni //

analyzed: gzugs can min dang cig shos med //

translated: The representations of eye, etc., have form, etc., as their causal-signs, and the seeing of those consciousnesses, up to the seeing of the body consciousness, are together with causal-signs.

analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pas ni lta ba dang bcas pa ste /

original: sems tsam la ni zhugs gyur pa //

analyzed: sems pa la lus dang ngag gi las zhes bya ba bzhin no snyam mo //

analyzed: de ni don tsam du snang ba dang / rnam par rtog par snang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gis de nyid kun tu brtags pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /

analyzed: kun tu rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang / des kun tu brtags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gis de nyid yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gang zhe na /

original: yang kun tu rtog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang kun tu rtog pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: byang ba ni tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyi kun tu rtog pa'o //

analyzed: ma byang ba ni tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams kyi kun tu rtog pa'o //

original: yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa lnga ste /

original: ming la brten te don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming la brten te don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ming 'di'i don ni 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //

original: don la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don 'di'i ming ni 'di yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The name of this object is this.”

original: ming la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: ming la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste ;

analyzed: don ma rtogs pa'i ming la kun tu rtog pa'o //
translated: “The name of the object that is not understood.”

original: don la brten te don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: don la brten te don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Imagination of the nature of the object based on the object, as when one thinks,

original: ming ma rtogs pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa'o //🔽de gnyi ga la brten te /
analyzed: ming ma rtogs pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid la kun tu rtog pa'o // de gnyi ga la brten te /

original: de gnyi ga la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la kun tu rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: don 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid 'di'i ming ni 'di'o zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: thams cad bsdu na rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcu ste / rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o // mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o //🔽mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽@17b rten dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o // mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste / @17b rten dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of signs is the representations of form, etc.

original: mtshan ma 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conceptualization of the appearance of signs is the representations of the eye consciousness, etc., together with their supports.

original: rga ba la sogs pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / gnod pa dang dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas de 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rga ba la sogs pa dang / bde ba'i tshor ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / gnod pa dang dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pas de 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The conceptualization of the transformation of signs is the transformation of the signs of aging, etc., of pleasant and unpleasant feelings, of attachment, etc., of harm and the passage of time, etc., and of the destinies of hell beings, etc., and of the realm of desire, etc.

original: mtshan mar snang ba 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /

original: ji skad smos pa'i 'gyur ba 'di dag nyid kyis de 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i 'gyur ba 'di dag nyid kyis de 'gyur ba'o //

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
