original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the conceptualization that follows from listening to non-Dharma and the conceptualization that follows from listening to Dharma.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conceptualization of non-reality is as follows:

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from listening to non-Dharma.

original: 'di las phyir rol pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las phyir rol pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of those outside this teaching.

original: tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conceptualization of reality is as follows:

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from listening to Dharma.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the conceptualization of those within this teaching.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The conceptualization of attachment is as follows:

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa las byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba ltar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa las byung ba'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba ltar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a discursive thought that is associated with the sixty-two views that arise from the root of the view of individuality, which in turn arises from the misapprehension of the self.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Discursive thought of distraction is as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten kinds of discursive thought for the bodhisattvas.

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dngos po'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gcig pa nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dngos po'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gcig pa nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang /
translated: They are the distraction of the sign of the inexistent, the distraction of the sign of the existent, the distraction of superimposition, the distraction of denial, the distraction of identity,

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ngo bo nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / khyad par du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par g-yeng ba dang ; don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ngo bo nyid du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / khyad par du rnam par g-yeng ba dang / ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par g-yeng ba dang ; don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Distraction of multiplicity, distraction of identity, distraction of distinction, distraction of the meaning according to the word, and distraction of the word according to the meaning.

original: de la dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: With regard to that, the meaning of the antidote to the conception of non-entity is stated:

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “While existing as a bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /🔽byang chub sems @18a * //
analyzed: dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa / byang chub sems @18a * //
translated: The meaning of the antidote to the conception of entity is stated:

original: dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva does not see the bodhisattva.”

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The meaning of the antidote to the conception of superimposition is stated:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: “The bodhisattva does not see the name ‘bodhisattva.’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see “practice.”

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
translated: He does not see form.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because a name is empty of a basic nature.

original: skur ba 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: skur ba 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of denial is stated:

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not by emptiness.

original: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of identity is stated:

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of difference is stated:

original: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /🔽gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan pa yang ma yin te / gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.🔽Form itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa //
translated: The antidote to the conception of intrinsic reality is stated in the following:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This so-called form is merely a name.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of distinction is stated in the following:

original: ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin //🔽rnam par byang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin // rnam par byang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Intrinsic reality is not produced or stopped, not defiled or purified.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of the object as it is denoted by the name is stated in the following:

original: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor rtog nas ming glo bur gyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor rtog nas ming glo bur gyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: When one analyzes those phenomena in fabricated names, one imputes conventional designations with adventitious names.

original: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The more one engages in conventional expressions, the more one becomes attached.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conception of names as corresponding to objects is stated in the passage:

original: byang chub sems dpa' ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see any of those names as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su ming mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ming mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since he does not see them as real, he is not attached.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that they correspond to objects as they are.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as with form, the same should be applied up to consciousness.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi gnyen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bstan te /
translated: The antidote to these ten distractions is taught to be nonconceptual wisdom in all the perfections of wisdom.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @18b phyin pa'i don mtha' dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu @18b phyin pa'i don mtha' dag ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the entire meaning of the perfection of wisdom should be understood as the resistances and their remedies.

original: gal te rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gsum yin du zin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gsum yin du zin na /
translated: If the dependent nature is threefold by way of its synonyms,

original: 'o na ji ltar ngo bo nyid du gsum bye brag med par mi 'gyur zhes na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ngo bo nyid du gsum bye brag med par mi 'gyur zhes na /
translated: then how is it that the three natures are not without distinction?

original: rnam grangs gang gis gzhan gyi dbang yin pas des kun tu brtags pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis gzhan gyi dbang yin pas des kun tu brtags pa ma yin /
translated: By way of the synonyms of the dependent nature, it is not imagined,

original: yongs su grub pa ma yin no //🔽rnam grangs gang gis kun tu brtags pa yin pa des gzhan gyis dbang ma yin yongs su grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ma yin no // rnam grangs gang gis kun tu brtags pa yin pa des gzhan gyis dbang ma yin yongs su grub pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it perfected.🔽By way of the synonyms of the imagined nature, it is not dependent, nor is it perfected.

original: rnam grangs gang gis yongs su grub pa gang yin pa des gzhan gyi dang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis yongs su grub pa gang yin pa des gzhan gyi dang ma yin /
translated: By way of the synonyms of the perfected nature, it is not dependent,

original: kun brtags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it imagined.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar snang ba de'i bdag nyid ma yin par cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar snang ba de'i bdag nyid ma yin par cis mngon zhe na /
translated: How is it known that the dependent nature is not the same as the imagined nature, as it appears to be?

original: ming gi snga rol na blo med pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba dang / ming mang pos bdag mang por ba dang / ming nges pa med pas bdag 'dres par 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ming gi snga rol na blo med pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba dang / ming mang pos bdag mang por ba dang / ming nges pa med pas bdag 'dres par 'gal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is known because it is contradictory for it to be the same as the imagined nature, since there is no cognition prior to the name, since many names would entail many selves, and since the absence of a fixed name would entail a confused self.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here there is a verse:

original: ming gi snga rol blo med phyir //
analyzed: ming gi snga rol blo med phyir //
translated: Because there is no cognition prior to the name,

original: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
analyzed: mang ba'i phyir dang ma nges phyir //
translated: because there are many names, and because there is no fixed rule,🔽it is established that it is contradictory for the dependent nature to be the same as the imagined nature,

original: de yi bdag nyid bdag mang dang // bdag 'dres 'gal bas grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid bdag mang dang // bdag 'dres 'gal bas grub par 'gyur //
translated: because the self would be many and confused.🔽The nonexistence of phenomena is the object of observation,

original: chos rnams med la dmigs pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs med rnam dag //
analyzed: chos rnams med la dmigs pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs med rnam dag //
translated: and they are completely afflicted and completely purified.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa med 'dra dang // de bzhin mkha' 'drar shes par bya //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa med 'dra dang // de bzhin mkha' 'drar shes par bya //
translated: They are like an illusion, etc., and like space.

original: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du med du zin na /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du med du zin na /
translated: If things did not exist as they appear,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi thams cad du med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad kyi thams cad du med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would the other-dependent nature not be totally nonexistent?

original: de med na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med de thams cad med pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de med na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med de thams cad med pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that does not exist, the perfected nature would not exist, and why would not everything be nonexistent?

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med du zin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid med du zin na /
translated: If the other-dependent nature and the perfected nature did not exist,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the errors of the nonexistence of defilement and purification would ensue.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ni dmigs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ni dmigs so //
translated: But defilement and purification are perceived.

original: de lta bas na thams cad med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not everything is nonexistent.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa //
translated: If the other-dependent and the perfected

original: rnam pa kun tu yod min na //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu yod min na //
translated: were totally nonexistent,

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag //
translated: then defilement and purification

original: dus kun tu ni med par 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kun tu ni med par 'gyur //
translated: would be totally nonexistent.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa bstan pa gang yin pa'i bstan pa der kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /🔽med pa'i rnam grangs @19a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis theg pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa bstan pa gang yin pa'i bstan pa der kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na / med pa'i rnam grangs @19a * //
translated: How should one understand the imagined nature in the teaching of the Bhagavat Buddhas, in the extensive teaching of the Great Vehicle?

original: bstan pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bstan pas rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood through the teaching of the synonyms of non-existence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the relative nature?

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / chu zla dang / sprul pa lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as being like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, an optical illusion, a reflection, an echo, the moon in the water, and a magical creation.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the perfect nature?

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi bstan pas rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood through the teaching of the four dharmas of purification.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi la /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnam pa bzhi la /
translated: The four dharmas of purification are:

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The naturally pure is as follows:

original: de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa ste /
translated: The Reality, the Voidness, the Ultimate, the Signless, and the Absolute

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang de yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang de yin no //
translated: are also the Dharma-element.

original: dri ma med par rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dri ma med par rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The purification of the stainless is as follows:

original: de nyid sgrib pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid sgrib pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the same, but it is not associated with any obscurations.

original: de thob pa'i lam rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de thob pa'i lam rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The purification of the path to attain it is as follows:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is all the elements that are favorable to enlightenment, the perfections, and so on.

original: de bskyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The purification of the objective supports for producing it is as follows:

original: theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dam pa'i chos bstan pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of the true Dharma of the Great Vehicle,

original: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu brtags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rnam par byang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun tu brtags pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not imagined, since it is the cause of purification.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas gzhan gyi dbang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other-dependent, since it is the natural outcome of the purification of the Dharma-element.

original: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bsdus pa yin no //
translated: By these four aspects, all the elements of purification are included.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: byung rten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
analyzed: byung rten sgyu ma la sogs bstan //
translated: The dependent is taught to be like an illusion, etc.

original: rtags la brten nas med pa bstan //🔽rnam par dag pa bzhi brten nas //
analyzed: rtags la brten nas med pa bstan // rnam par dag pa bzhi brten nas //
translated: The sign is taught to be non-existent.

original: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa bstan pa yin //
translated: The perfected is taught in dependence on the four purifications.

original: dag pa de ni rang bzhin dang // dri ma med pa dang lam dang dmigs //
analyzed: dag pa de ni rang bzhin dang // dri ma med pa dang lam dang dmigs //
translated: That purification is of three kinds: natural, stainless, and path.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rnams //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi rnams //
translated: All the elements of purification

original: rnam pa bzhi pos bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pos bsdus pa yin //
translated: are included in the four aspects.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ci'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ci'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is the relative nature taught to be like an illusion, etc., as stated?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzhan dag nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzhan dag nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to turn others away from doubt about the relative nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzhan dag ji ltar nor ba nyid du som nyi za bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzhan dag ji ltar nor ba nyid du som nyi za bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do others doubt the relative nature?

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag 'di snyam du don med pa ji ltar spyod yul du 'gyur snyam du sems pa de dag gi som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag 'di snyam du don med pa ji ltar spyod yul du 'gyur snyam du sems pa de dag gi som nyi za ba de bzlog pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, in order to eliminate the doubt of those who think, “How can the unreal be an object?” it is said that it is like an illusion.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba don med pa rnams ji @19b ltar dbyung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir smig rgyu lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba don med pa rnams ji @19b ltar dbyung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir smig rgyu lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “How can unreal mind and mental factors arise?” it is said that they are like a mirage.

original: don med na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nyer bar spyod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir rmi lam lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i nyer bar spyod par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir rmi lam lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If they are unreal, how can there be the experience of the desirable and the undesirable?” it is said that they are like a dream.

original: don med na las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med na las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa ji ltar mngon par 'grub par 'gyur snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If they are unreal, how can the desirable and undesirable results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions be produced?” it is said that they are like a reflection.

original: don med na ji ltar rnam par shes pa sna tshogs 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir mig yor lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med na ji ltar rnam par shes pa sna tshogs 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir mig yor lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If there are no objects, how can various consciousnesses arise?” it is said that they are like optical illusions.

original: don med na ji ltar tha snyad brjod pa sna tshogs 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir grag ca  lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med na ji ltar tha snyad brjod pa sna tshogs 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir grag ca  lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If there are no objects, how can various conventional expressions arise?” it is said that they are like echoes.

original: don med na ji ltar yang dag par 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir chu zla lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: don med na ji ltar yang dag par 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul 'byung snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir chu zla lta bu nyid do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If there are no objects, how can the objects of samādhi that are correctly apprehended arise?” it is said that they are like the moon in water.

original: don med na byang chub sems dpa' sems phyin ci ma log pa rnams sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir bsams bzhin du ji ltar skye snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir sprul pa lta bu nyid bstan to //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te /
analyzed: don med na byang chub sems dpa' sems phyin ci ma log pa rnams sems can gyi bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir bsams bzhin du ji ltar skye snyam du som nyi za ba bzlog pa'i phyir sprul pa lta bu nyid bstan to // bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt, “If there are no objects, how can bodhisattvas who are not mistaken about the mind intentionally take birth in order to accomplish the welfare of sentient beings?” it is said that they are like magical incarnations.🔽What did the Bhagavat have in mind when he said in the Questions of Brahma Sutra:

original: tshangs pas zhus pa las de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: tshangs pas zhus pa las de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba yang mi dmigs /
translated: “The Tathagata does not apprehend saṃsāra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi dmigs zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: If you say that nirvana is also not perceived,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid bye brag med pa las dgongs nas bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun tu brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid bye brag med pa las dgongs nas bstan te /
translated: then it is taught with the intention that samsara and nirvana are not different, because the other-dependent nature is both the imagined nature and the perfected nature.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid kun tu brtags pa'i chos ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid kun tu brtags pa'i chos ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Thus, the other-dependent nature itself is samsara in terms of the imagined reality.

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽chos mngon pa'i mdo las chos nyi gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // chos mngon pa'i mdo las chos nyi gsum ste /
translated: It is nirvana in terms of the perfected reality.🔽In the Abhidharma Sūtra, the Bhagavān said, “There are three natures:🔽the afflicted, the purified, and that which belongs to both.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa ci las dgongs te gsungs she na /
translated: With what intention did he say this?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i thar gtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i thar gtogs pa'o ;
translated: The existence of the imagined nature in the other-dependent nature belongs to the afflicted class.

original: ; yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ; yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: The perfected nature, which exists, is included in the category of purification.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid ni de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid ni de gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: That very relative nature is included in both categories.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bka' stsal to //
translated: It is with this intention that the Lord has spoken.

original: don 'di la dpe ci yod ce na /
analyzed: don 'di la dpe ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the example of this meaning?

original: dpe ni sa khong na gser yod pa ste /🔽dper na sa khong na gser yod pa la ni sa'i @20a * //
analyzed: dpe ni sa khong na gser yod pa ste / dper na sa khong na gser yod pa la ni sa'i @20a * //
translated: The example is the gold in the earth.

original: khams dang sa dang gser dang gsum dmigs so //
analyzed: khams dang sa dang gser dang gsum dmigs so //
translated: For example, in the earth where gold exists, the earth element, earth, and gold are perceived as three.

original: de la sa'i khams la ni med pa'i sa dmigs la /
analyzed: de la sa'i khams la ni med pa'i sa dmigs la /
translated: In that case, the earth element is perceived as earth,

original: yod pa'i gser ni mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yod pa'i gser ni mi dmigs te /
translated: and the gold that exists is not perceived.

original: 'di ltar mes reg nas ni mi snang la gser ni snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar mes reg nas ni mi snang la gser ni snang ngo //
translated: For when it is touched by fire, it does not appear as earth, but appears as gold.

original: sa'i khams ni sar snang ba la log par snang ngo //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sar snang ba la log par snang ngo //
translated: The earth element appears as earth, but appears falsely.

original: gser du snang ba na de bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: gser du snang ba na de bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: When it appears as gold, it appears as it really is.

original: de bas na sa'i khams ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sa'i khams ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the earth element is included in both categories.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rig pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mes ma reg pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rig pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mes ma reg pa na /
translated: In the same way, when the consciousness is not touched by the fire of nonconceptual wisdom,

original: rnam par rig pa de yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang gi /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang gi /
translated: That consciousness appears as the imagined nature, which is not real.

original: yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi snang la /
analyzed: yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi snang la /
translated: It does not appear as the perfected nature, which is real.

original: rnam par shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mes reg pa na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mes reg pa na /
translated: When consciousness is touched by the fire of nonconceptual intuition,

original: rnam par rig pa de yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang gi /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de yang dag pa yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang gi /
translated: that consciousness appears as the perfected nature, which is real.

original: log par kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: log par kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du ni mi snang ngo //
translated: It does not appear as the imagined nature, which is unreal.

original: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i rnam par rig pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i rnam par rig pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de ni gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the relative nature, which is the consciousness of unreal imagination, is included in both natures,

original: sa khong na gser yod pa la sa'i khams bzhin no //
analyzed: sa khong na gser yod pa la sa'i khams bzhin no //
translated: just as the earth element is included in both the earth and gold.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis la lar ni chos thams cad rtag go zhes bstan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis la lar ni chos thams cad rtag go zhes bstan /
translated: The Lord has taught in some places that all things are permanent,

original: la lar ni mi rtag go zhes bstan /
analyzed: la lar ni mi rtag go zhes bstan /
translated: and in some places that they are impermanent.

original: la lar ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ci las dgongs te rtag pa zhes bstan zhe na /
analyzed: la lar ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa ci las dgongs te rtag pa zhes bstan zhe na /
translated: Some say, It is neither permanent nor impermanent. What is the intention behind the teaching that it is permanent?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i chas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su grub pa'i chas rtag pa'o //
translated: The dependent nature is permanent in terms of the aspect of the consummate nature.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: It is impermanent in terms of the aspect of the imagined nature.

original: gnyi ga'i chas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa 'di las dgongs nas bstan to //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa 'di las dgongs nas bstan to //
translated: It is neither permanent nor impermanent in terms of both. The teaching is made with this intention.

original: ji ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang gnyis su med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang gnyis su med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is neither permanent nor impermanent,🔽it is also neither blissful nor miserable, neither pure nor impure, neither self nor not self,🔽neither with signs nor signless,🔽neither with wishes nor wishless,🔽neither calm nor not calm,

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag kyang gnyis su med pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dag kyang gnyis su med pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang gnyis su med pa dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dag kyang gnyis su med pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dag kyang gnyis su med pa dang / stong pa dang mi stong pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa dang gnyis su med pa dang /
translated: and neither afflicted nor unafflicted.

original: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang gnyis su med pa dang / ngo bo nyid yod pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gnyis su med pa dang /
analyzed: zhi ba dang ma zhi ba dang gnyis su med pa dang / ngo bo nyid yod pa dang ngo bo nyid med pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa dang gnyis su med pa dang /
translated: arising and nonarising are not two,🔽cessation and noncessation are not two,🔽pristine peace and nonpristine peace are not two,🔽natural nirvana and nonnirvana are not two,🔽and samsara and nirvana are not two.

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang gzod ma nas ma zhi ba dang gnyis su med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang bzhin gyis @20b mya ngan las ma 'das pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag kyang gnyis su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ldem po dag thams cad rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs stan pa
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba dang gzod ma nas ma zhi ba dang gnyis su med pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa dang / rang bzhin gyis @20b mya ngan las ma 'das pa dang gnyis su med pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag kyang gnyis su med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ldem po dag thams cad rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs stan pa
translated: The buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, have taught all of these categories, such as permanence and impermanence, as provisional meanings.

original: bzhin du / ngo bo nyid gsum yin pa dag tu khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin du / ngo bo nyid gsum yin pa dag tu khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that all things are of the nature of the three realities.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: ji ltar chos rnams yod min zhing //
analyzed: ji ltar chos rnams yod min zhing //
translated: How are things nonexistent?

original: ji ltar rnam pa du mar snang //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa du mar snang //
translated: How do they appear in many ways?

original: de bzhin chos dang chos med pa //
analyzed: de bzhin chos dang chos med pa //
translated: Thus, the nonduality of things and nonthings

original: gnyis su med pa'i don du bstan //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don du bstan //
translated: Is taught to be the ultimate truth.🔽Sometimes they are taught to be nonexistent,

original: cha res de dag med pa dang // yod pa zhes ni rab tu bstan //🔽gnyi ga'i chas ni yod min zhing //
analyzed: cha res de dag med pa dang // yod pa zhes ni rab tu bstan // gnyi ga'i chas ni yod min zhing //
translated: And sometimes to be existent.🔽Sometimes they are taught to be neither existent nor nonexistent,

original: med pa'ang min zhes brjod pa mdzad //
analyzed: med pa'ang min zhes brjod pa mdzad //
translated: And sometimes to be both existent and nonexistent.

original: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin med //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de bzhin med //
translated: They are not as they appear to be,

original: de phyir med ces brjod pa mdzad //
analyzed: de phyir med ces brjod pa mdzad //
translated: And therefore they are said to be nonexistent.

original: gang phyir de ltar snang gyur pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar snang gyur pa //
translated: But because they appear in that way,

original: de phyir yod ces brjod pa mdzad //🔽rang dang bdag nyid med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de phyir yod ces brjod pa mdzad // rang dang bdag nyid med pa'i phyir //
translated: They are said to be existent.🔽Because they are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: rang gi dngos la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: rang gi dngos la mi gnas phyir //
translated: And because they do not abide in their own nature,

original: gzung ba bzhin du de med phyir //🔽ngo bo nyid med du bzhed pa //
analyzed: gzung ba bzhin du de med phyir // ngo bo nyid med du bzhed pa //
translated: And because they are like the apprehended object,🔽They are said to be devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid ni med pa yis //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni med pa yis //
translated: Because they are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: phyi ma phyi ma brten byas te //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma brten byas te //
translated: The later ones are dependent on the earlier ones.

original: skye med 'gag med gzod zhi dang // rang bzhin mya ngan 'das par grub //
analyzed: skye med 'gag med gzod zhi dang // rang bzhin mya ngan 'das par grub //
translated: primordially peaceful, and naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: yang dgongs pa bzhin dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhis sangs rgyas kyi gsung thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dgongs pa bzhin dang ldem por dgongs pa bzhis sangs rgyas kyi gsung thams cad khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand all the Buddha's words by means of four intentions and four indirect teachings.

original: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention of sameness is illustrated by the statement:

original: da nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs su gyur to zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: da nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs su gyur to zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: At that time, I was the Tathagata Vipasyin.

original: dus gzhan la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention of another time is illustrated by the statement:🔽By merely remembering the name of the Tathagata Ratnasaṃbhava, one will certainly attain supreme enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen mang gi mtshan bzung bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu dang smon lam btab pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba cad du skye bar 'gyur ro🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen mang gi mtshan bzung bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu dang smon lam btab pa tsam gyis 'jig rten gyi khams bde ba cad du skye bar 'gyur ro🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And by merely making the aspiration, one will be born in the world Sukhavati.

original: don gzhan la dgongs pa ni sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: don gzhan la dgongs pa ni sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “One who has served as many Buddhas as there are sands of the Ganges will understand the meaning of the teaching of the Great Vehicle.”

original: gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The intention of the inclination of the person is, for example,

original: gang zag kha cig la sbyin pa bsngags la /🔽de nyid la bsngags pa ma yin pa'ang gsungs pa dang / sbyin pa ji lta bar tshul khrims dang @21a * //
analyzed: gang zag kha cig la sbyin pa bsngags la / de nyid la bsngags pa ma yin pa'ang gsungs pa dang / sbyin pa ji lta bar tshul khrims dang @21a * //
translated: the praise of generosity for some persons,🔽and the criticism of generosity for the very same persons, as well as the praise of morality and the criticism of morality,

original: bsgom pa kha cig kyang de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsgom pa kha cig kyang de bzhin du /
translated: and so on up to🔽the praise of contemplation and the criticism of contemplation.

original: 'di ni dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: This is the fourfold intention.

original: yang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang ldem por dgongs pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are also four indirect intentions:

original: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste / nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: The indirect intention concerning entry is, for example,

original: theg pa chen por gang zag dang tshos kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen por gang zag dang tshos kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul du bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the reality nature of persons and things in the form of universals in the Vehicle of the Auditeers or in the Great Vehicle.

original: mtshan nyid la ldan por dgongs pa ni gang du chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pas ngo bo nyid du gsum po dag ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la ldan por dgongs pa ni gang du chos kyi mtshan nyid bstan pas ngo bo nyid du gsum po dag ston pa'o //
translated: The intention of possession in regard to characteristics is that by teaching the characteristics of things, the three natures are taught.

original: gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa ni /
translated: The intention of possession in regard to antidotes is

original: gang du spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang du spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po bstan pa'o //
translated: that by teaching the antidotes to the eighty-four thousand types of conduct,

original: bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa ni gang du sgras don gzhan du brjod la /
analyzed: bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa ni gang du sgras don gzhan du brjod la /
translated: the intention of possession in regard to transformation is that by one word, another meaning is expressed,

original: don nyid gzhan du ston pa ste /
analyzed: don nyid gzhan du ston pa ste /
translated: and the meaning itself is taught in another way.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: snying po med pa la snying por shes //
analyzed: snying po med pa la snying por shes //
translated: Knowing the insubstantial as substantial,

original: phyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
analyzed: phyin ci log la shin tu gnas //
translated: Dwelling in error,

original: nyon mongs kun nas rab nyon mongs //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun nas rab nyon mongs //
translated: Completely afflicted by the afflictions,

original: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: One attains the highest enlightenment.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos 'chad par 'dod pas mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum gyis bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos 'chad par 'dod pas mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum gyis bshad par bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to explain the Dharma of the Great Vehicle should explain it in brief in three ways:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / bshad zin pa'i don bstan pas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa dang / bshad zin pa'i don bstan pas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of dependent origination, the teaching of the characteristics of the dharmas that are dependently originated, and the teaching of the meaning of what has been explained.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of dependent origination is as follows:

original: chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las byung ste de dag nyid las de zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las byung ste de dag nyid las de zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: “The dharmas arise from the latent impressions of verbalization. They arise from those very dharmas.”

original: rnam par smin pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun du rkyen du gyur pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dag phan tshun du rkyen du gyur pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fruitional consciousness and the active consciousnesses arise from each other as conditions.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Those dharmas that have the characteristic of active consciousness are the essence of representations with signs and views.

original: de dag kyang gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are also characterized by the basis, the imagined, and reality.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the characteristics of the three natures.

original: rgyu mtshan lta dang bcas pa las //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan lta dang bcas pa las //
translated: From the standpoint of the reason,

original: de dag mtshan nyid gsum shes bya //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de dag mtshan nyid gsum shes bya // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: they should be known as the three natures.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: How should their characteristics be explained?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med la /
translated: The imagined characteristic does not exist in the dependent nature,

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de na yod na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni de na yod na /
translated: but the perfected characteristic does exist in it.

original: de kho na ma mthong ba dang mthong bas dus gcig tu de gnyi ga yod pa dang med par mi dmigs pa'am dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na ma mthong ba dang mthong bas dus gcig tu de gnyi ga yod pa dang med par mi dmigs pa'am dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since one does not see reality, one does not apprehend the existence or nonexistence of both at the same time.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo @21b nyid la kun brtags pa med pa dang yongs su grub pa yod pa'i phyir 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo @21b nyid la kun brtags pa med pa dang yongs su grub pa yod pa'i phyir 'byung ste /
translated: The dependent nature arises because the imagined is absent and the perfected is present in the dependent nature.

original: de dmigs pa na de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa na de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one apprehends the dependent, one does not apprehend the imagined.

original: de mi dmigs pa na de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa na de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one does not apprehend the dependent, one does apprehend the perfected.

original: gzhan dbang la ni brtags pa med //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brtags pa med //
translated: The imagined does not exist in the dependent.

original: yongs su grub pa de na yod //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa de na yod //
translated: That is the perfected nature.

original: de phyir de la gnyi ga yang //
analyzed: de phyir de la gnyi ga yang //
translated: Therefore, both are the same

original: mi dmigs dmigs pa mnyam pa yin //
analyzed: mi dmigs dmigs pa mnyam pa yin //
translated: in being non-apprehensible and apprehensible.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained.

original: bshad zin pa don bshad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bshad zin pa don bshad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the explanation of the explanation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: tshig sngar bshad zin pa'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis de yon tan gyi dbang du bya ba'o /
analyzed: tshig sngar bshad zin pa'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis de yon tan gyi dbang du bya ba'o /
translated: The remaining words of the previously explained words are from the perspective of its qualities.

original: don gyi dbang du bya bas rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang du bya bas rnam par phye ste bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught through the analysis from the perspective of its meaning.

original: yon tan gyi dbang du bya ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dbang du bya ba ni /
translated: From the perspective of its qualities,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba kun tu spyod pa gnyis mi mnga' ba /
translated: It is endowed with a completely pure mind, is free from the two actions,

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i chos la mchog tu gzhol bar mdzad pa /
translated: is directed to the supreme of the dharmas that are without characteristics,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pas gnas pa /
translated: abides in the abiding of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid brnyes pa /
translated: has attained the sameness of all buddhas,

original: sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs par thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa mi mnga' bas rtogs par thugs su chud pa /
translated: has realized the nonexistence of obscurations,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa /
translated: and possesses the Dharma of irreversibility.

original: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa /
analyzed: spyod yul gyis mi 'phrogs pa /
translated: He is not carried away by objects.

original: rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: He has inconceivable ways of being.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa /
translated: He has realized the equality of the three times.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i sku dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa'i sku dang ldan pa /
translated: He has a body that pervades all world systems.

original: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad la the tshom med pa'i ye shes mnga' ba /
translated: He has the wisdom that is free of doubt regarding all phenomena.

original: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba /
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i blo mnga' ba /
translated: He has a mind that is endowed with all conduct.

original: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur med pa /
analyzed: chos mkhyen pa la nem nur med pa /
translated: He has the knowledge of phenomena that is free of doubt.

original: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba /
analyzed: rnam par ma brtags pa'i sku mnga' ba /
translated: He has a body that is not conceptualized.

original: ye shes byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par mos pa /
analyzed: ye shes byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yang dag par mos pa /
translated: He is the wisdom that is truly aspired to by all bodhisattvas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa gnyis su med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: He has perfected the nondual state of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma 'dres pa'i rnam par thar par mdzad pa'i ye shes kyi mthar phyin pa /
translated: He has perfected the wisdom that creates the distinct liberation of the tathāgatas.

original: mtha' dang dpung med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: mtha' dang dpung med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa /
translated: He has realized the equality of the buddha level that is free of extremes and sides.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa /
translated: He is as vast as the realm of phenomena.

original: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: It extends to the end of space,

original: phyin ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams bstan pa'o /
analyzed: phyin ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams bstan pa'o /
translated: it reaches to the end of the future.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshig lhag ma rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i rnam par dbye ba ni tshig lhag ma rnams yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The phrase “endowed with a completely pure mind” is analyzed into the remaining phrases.

original: de ltar na chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos nyid legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of reality is explained well.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi blo shin tu rnam par dag pa @22a * //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i blo mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi blo shin tu rnam par dag pa @22a * //
translated: “Endowed with a completely pure mind” refers to the completely pure mind of the transcendent lords, the buddhas.

original: 'di ni yon tan bcu dgus bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan bcu dgus bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is summarized by nineteen qualities.

original: shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnams par dag pa shes par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: shes bya la shin tu sgrib pa med par 'jug pa'i yon tan dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid mchog tu rnams par dag pa shes par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rgyun mi gcod par gnas pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the quality of engaging objects of knowledge without the slightest obscuration, the quality of knowing the supreme and complete purity of suchness, the characteristic of the nonduality of existence and nonexistence, the quality of remaining in the unceasing and spontaneous activities of the buddhas,

original: chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang dgongs pa dang / phrin las tha dad pa med pa'i yon tan dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la gnas pa dang dgongs pa dang / phrin las tha dad pa med pa'i yon tan dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang / mu stegs can thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the quality of the dharmakāya being without distinctions of location, intention, and activity, the quality of cultivating the antidotes to all obscurations, the quality of being unassailable by any tīrthikas, the quality of not being swayed by worldly phenomena even though one is born in the world,

original: chos rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang / the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang / spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang /
analyzed: chos rnam par gzhag pa'i yon tan dang / lung ston pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku ston pa'i yon tan dang / the tshom gcod pa'i yon tan dang / spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'jug par mdzad pa'i yon tan dang /
translated: the qualities of presenting the Dharma, the qualities of giving predictions, the qualities of displaying the enjoyment and emanation bodies in all worldly realms, the qualities of resolving doubts, the qualities of engaging in various activities,🔽the qualities of knowing the future arising of the Dharma, the qualities of teaching in accordance with inclinations, the qualities of applying to train sentient beings with immeasurable bodies, the qualities of accomplishing the perfections in the equality of the dharmakaya,

original: phyi ma la chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan dang / sku dpag tu med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'grub pa'i yon tan dang ;
analyzed: phyi ma la chos 'byung ba mkhyen pa'i yon tan dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i yon tan dang / sku dpag tu med pas sems can 'dul bar sbyor ba'i yon tan dang / chos kyi sku mnyam pa la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'grub pa'i yon tan dang ;
translated: and the qualities of the inconceivable Dharma.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang / 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma 'dres pa ston pa'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum gyi yul yongs su ma chad pa'i yon tan dang / 'khor ba'i mtha' ji tsam par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang /
translated: The qualities of displaying unmixed buddha realms in accordance with the inclinations of beings, the quality of the domain of the three buddha bodies being uninterrupted, the quality of benefit and happiness for all sentient beings being present for as long as cyclic existence lasts,

original: bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang / mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: bde ba nye bar gnas pa'i yon tan dang / mi zad pa nyid kyi yon tan rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: and the quality of inexhaustibility are included.

original: don gyi dbang du bya ba ni yang byang chub sems dpa' chos sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don gyi dbang du bya ba ni yang byang chub sems dpa' chos sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning is as follows: If bodhisattvas possess thirty two qualities, they are called bodhisattvas.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty two?

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa dang bdag ci ri zhes yongs su shes pa dang / nga rgyal bcom pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la 'dzud pa dang bdag ci ri zhes yongs su shes pa dang / nga rgyal bcom pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang /
translated: It is to have the superior intention to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings. It is to introduce them to omniscient wisdom and to know what is appropriate for oneself. It is to have destroyed pride and to have a stable superior intention.

original: bcos ma ma yin par byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthong bar du gtan du @22b mdza' ba dang / tshig ran pa dang / 'dzum pa'i bzhin gyis gsong por smra ba dang /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin par byams pa dang / mdza' ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems snyoms pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthong bar du gtan du @22b mdza' ba dang / tshig ran pa dang / 'dzum pa'i bzhin gyis gsong por smra ba dang /
translated: It is to have uncontrived love, to have an impartial mind toward friends and enemies, to have constant affection until the vision of nirvāṇa, to be moderate in speech, and to speak pleasantly with a smiling face.

original: snying rje chen po yongs su ma chad pa dang / khur blangs pa rnams la skyid lug pa med pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / thos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong ba dang / bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams la nyes par lta ba dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yongs su ma chad pa dang / khur blangs pa rnams la skyid lug pa med pa dang / yid yongs su mi skyo ba dang / thos pa dang don gyis ngoms mi myong ba dang / bdag gi 'khrul pa rnams la nyes par lta ba dang /
translated: It is to have uninterrupted great compassion, to be indefatigable in taking on burdens, to have an unwearying mind, to be insatiable in listening and in the meaning, to see one’s own mistakes as faults,

original: bzhin gyi 'khrul pa rnams la mi gshe bar bsgo ba dang / spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i sbyin pa dang / srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: bzhin gyi 'khrul pa rnams la mi gshe bar bsgo ba dang / spyod lam thams cad du byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / rnam par smin pa la mi re ba'i sbyin pa dang / srid pa'i 'gro bar skye ba thams cad la mi gnas pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: not to be angry at the mistakes of the retinue, to train in the thought of awakening in all activities, to give without hope of karmic reward, to be ethical without clinging to rebirths in cyclic existence,

original: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i bzod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rnam par bstsal ba'i bsam gtan dang / thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i bzod pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rnam par bstsal ba'i bsam gtan dang / thabs dang ldan pa'i shes rab dang /
translated: to be patient without being hostile to any sentient being, to be diligent in gathering all roots of virtue, to be concentrated in order to transcend the formless realm, and to be wise in possessing skillful means.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zin pa'i thabs dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la gnyis su med pa'i byams pa dang / gus par byas te chos nyan pa dang / gus par byas te dgon par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zin pa'i thabs dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la gnyis su med pa'i byams pa dang / gus par byas te chos nyan pa dang / gus par byas te dgon par gnas pa dang /
translated: dwelling in the wilderness with respect,🔽not delighting in worldly variety,🔽not wanting the Basic Vehicle,🔽seeing the benefits of the Great Vehicle,🔽abandoning evil companions,

original: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dag la mi dga' ba dang / theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa dang / theg pa chen po'i phan yon la lta ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dag la mi dga' ba dang / theg pa dman pa mi 'dod pa dang / theg pa chen po'i phan yon la lta ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten ba dang /
translated: relying on spiritual friends,🔽abandoning the four spheres of merit,🔽playing with the five kinds of preternatural knowledge,🔽relying on gnosis,

original: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhin yongs su spongs ba dang / mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtsen ba dang / ye shes la rton pa dang / sgrub pa dang log par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams mi gtong ba dang / tshig gcig tu chad pa dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhin yongs su spongs ba dang / mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtsen ba dang / ye shes la rton pa dang / sgrub pa dang log par sgrub pa la gnas pa'i sems can rnams mi gtong ba dang / tshig gcig tu chad pa dang /
translated: not abandoning sentient beings whether they are practicing correctly or not,

original: bden pa gces su byed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems de sngon du 'gro ba zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bden pa gces su byed pa dang / byang chub kyi sems de sngon du 'gro ba zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The first phrase is the same as the phrase having the thought of awakening as a prerequisite, as stated in the Bodhisattva Stages.

original: tshig 'di rnams kyis kyang tshig dang po rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o //🔽sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i tshig 'di ni las bcu drug gis rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig 'di rnams kyis kyang tshig dang po rab tu dbye bar rig par bya'o // sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya ba la phan pa dang / bde bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i tshig 'di ni las bcu drug gis rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
translated: These phrases should be understood as the first phrase, the division.🔽The phrase the superior intention to bring about the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings is to be understood as the division of sixteen activities.

original: de la las bcu drug ni gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sbyor ba'i las dang / phyin ci log med pa'i las dang / gzhan gyis byed du ma bcug par bdag nyid sbyor ba'i las dang / mi 'khrugs @23a * //

translated: Where does it engage? It engages in the mental expression that is the cause of Mahayana Dharma, which is the appearance of the Dharma and meaning together with the view, in the level of devoted conduct, the path of seeing, the path of meditation and the ultimate path.

original: chos thams cad rnam par rig pa tsam du rjes su sgrogs pa la mos pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du de rab tu rtogs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen po sgom pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i phyir ro //

translated: It engages in the level of devoted conduct through devotion to the proclamation that all phenomena are mere consciousness, it engages in the path of seeing through the realization of that just as it is, it engages in the path of meditation through meditating on the antidote to all obscurations and it engages in the ultimate path through the absence of obscurations.

original: ji ltar gang gis 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang gis 'jug ce na /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa dang / rnam pa gsum gyis sems sbyong ba dang / gnas bzhi spong ba dang / chos dang don la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa rtag tu dang gus par byas te sbyor ba la dang bag yod pas 'jug go //

translated: The bodhisattva applies himself constantly and respectfully to the cultivation of serenity and insight which have the Dharma and its meaning as their object, and he applies himself with faith and heedfulness.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rnams kyi mir gyur pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa dag skad cig gcig la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o snyam pa ni sems sbyong ba dang po'o ;

analyzed: ; bsam pa gang gis sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la kun tu spyod pa'i bsam pa de dag gis thob ste /
translated: The second purification of thought is the thought that one should attain those thoughts by which one practices the perfections such as generosity.

original: des bdag tshegs chung ngus pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro snyam pa ni sbyong ba gnyis pa'o //🔽dge ba sgrib pa dang bcas pa yang dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan na 'phral du shi la /🔽'bral du 'dod pa bzhin du lus thams cad phun sum tshogs par skye na /

translated: The second purification is the thought: “In this way, I will complete the cultivation of the transcendences with little difficulty.🔽” The third purification is the thought: “Even when virtue is obscured, if one has the virtues, one dies immediately and is reborn with a perfect body, just as one desires.

By abandoning attachment to the Dharma, they abandon attachment to the Dharma of listening and reflection, and the conceit of “I” and “mine.”

translated: The four investigations are those of names, things, natures, and distinctions, which arise from the cause of the imprints of hearing, are included within proper mental attention, and are verbal expressions of the mind that see the appearance of the Dharma and its meaning.🔽The four knowledges as they are in reality are those of names, things, natures, and distinctions.

original: ming dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnams kyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: ming dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnams kyis 'jug ste /
translated: They engage through the four investigations and the four knowledges as they are in reality,

original: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig pa tsam la 'jug par brtson pa de lta bu de ltar gyur pa de yi ge dang don snang ba'i yid kyi rjod pa de la yi ge'i ming de yang yid kyi rtog pa tsam du zad par yang dag🔽par rtog go //

translated: Thus, the bodhisattva who is striving to enter into representation only, having become such as this, correctly understands that the verbal expression of the mind that appears as letters and meanings is merely a mental conception of the name of the letter.

original: yid ge la brten pa'i don de yang yid kyi brjod pa tsam du zad pa de nyid du yang dag par rtog go //
analyzed: yid ge la brten pa'i don de yang yid kyi brjod pa tsam du zad pa de nyid du yang dag par rtog go //
translated: He correctly understands that the meaning that is based on the letter is merely a mental expression.

original: ming de yang @24b ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du brtags par zad pa tsam du yang dag par rtog go //🔽de'i phyir yid kyi rjod pa tsam du zad pa nyid du dmigs shing ming dang bcas pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: ming de yang @24b ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du brtags par zad pa tsam du yang dag par rtog go // de'i phyir yid kyi rjod pa tsam du zad pa nyid du dmigs shing ming dang bcas pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du btags pa dang bcas shing /
translated: He correctly understands that the name is merely a conceptual imputation of entityness and specific properties.

original: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du bcas pa don gyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pa na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du bcas pa don gyi mtshan nyid du mi dmigs pa na /
translated: Therefore, he observes that it is merely a mental expression, and he does not observe the meaning that is associated with the name, which is associated with the imputation of entityness and specific properties, as the characteristic of the object that is associated with entityness and specific properties.

original: yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag gis yi ge dang don snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'jug go //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po dag gis yi ge dang don snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'jug go //
translated: By means of the four investigations and the four knowledges of reality as it is, one enters into the mere representation of consciousness with regard to those mental conceptualizations that appear as letters and referents.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de la 'jug ces ni ji skad bya /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de la 'jug ces ni ji skad bya /
translated: How does one enter into the mere representation of consciousness?

original: ci 'dra bar ni 'jug ce na /

analyzed: mun khung na sprul du snang ba'i thag pa bzhin du 'jug ste /
translated: One enters into the imagined nature as if it were a snake in a rope, in a dark place.
