analyzed: dper na med pa'i phyir thag pa la sbrul ni nor pa ste /
translated: For example, a rope is mistaken for a snake because of the absence of light.

original: de'i don rtogs pa rnams ni med pa la sbrul gyi blo ldog cing /
analyzed: de'i don rtogs pa rnams ni med pa la sbrul gyi blo ldog cing /
translated: Those who understand the meaning of that, having turned away from the idea of a snake in the absence of light,

original: thag pa'i blor gnas so //
analyzed: thag pa'i blor gnas so //
translated: remain in the idea of a rope.

original: de yang rnam pa phra mor bya na nor pa ste ;
analyzed: de yang rnam pa phra mor bya na nor pa ste ;
translated: Moreover, if one makes the idea of a rope more subtle, it is a mistake,

original: kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la ji ltar kha dog la sogs pa'i blo la brten te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar kha dog la sogs pa'i blo la brten te /
translated: Just as the idea of a rope is turned away from in dependence on the idea of color, etc.,

original: thag pa'i blo yang bzlog par bya ba de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo la brten te /
analyzed: thag pa'i blo yang bzlog par bya ba de bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi blo la brten te /

analyzed: yi ge dang don rnam pa drug snang ba'i yid kyi rtog pa de dag la /
translated: in the same way, the idea of the six kinds of letters and meanings is turned away from in dependence on the idea of the perfected nature.

original: sbrul gyi blo bzhin du rnam pa drug la yang dag pa'i don bsal na /🔽rnam par rig pa tsam gyi blo yang rnam par gzhig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi blo bzhin du rnam pa drug la yang dag pa'i don bsal na /🔽rnam par rig pa tsam gyi blo yang rnam par gzhig par bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as the idea of a snake is destroyed by the removal of the snake in the six aspects,🔽in the same way, the idea of mere representation is destroyed by the removal of the six kinds of letters and meanings.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di yid kyi brjod pa snang ba'i don gyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' 'di yid kyi brjod pa snang ba'i don gyi mtshan nyid la 'jug pas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, by engaging in the appearance of mental expression, the characteristic of the meaning of the object,

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: engages the imagined nature.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam la 'jug pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam la 'jug pas gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: By engaging mere representation, he engages the dependent nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does he engage the perfected nature?

original: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi 'du shes kyang bzlog nas 'jug ste /🔽de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' don gyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa de la yid kyi @25a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam gyi 'du shes kyang bzlog nas 'jug ste / de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' don gyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa de la yid kyi @25a * //
translated: Having reversed the notion of mere representation, he engages it.

original: brjod pa thob pa'i chos kyi bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba de dag don du snang ba thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs med pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa thob pa'i chos kyi bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba de dag don du snang ba thams cad 'byung ba'i skabs med pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva, having destroyed the notion of the object, has no opportunity for the appearance of any object whatsoever, which arises from the cause of the latent impressions of mental expression and the dharmas.

original: des na rnam par rig pa tsam du snang ba yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: des na rnam par rig pa tsam du snang ba yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, the appearance of mere representation also does not arise.

original: gang gi tshe don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ming la gnas shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ming la gnas shing /
translated: When he abides in the nonconceptual name of all objects,

original: chos kyi dbyings la mngon sum gyi tshul gyis gnas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la mngon sum gyi tshul gyis gnas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he abides in the Dharma-dhâtu by direct intuition,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: then the non-discriminative intuition of the Bodhisattva, which is the equality of the objective and subjective, arises.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'di yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'di yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva enters into the perfected nature.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here there is a verse:🔽The object of name is differentiated

original: chos dang gang zag chos dang don //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag chos dang don //
translated: by the Dharma, the person, the Dharma and the meaning,

original: bsdus pa dang ni rgyas dang rigs //
analyzed: bsdus pa dang ni rgyas dang rigs //
translated: the concise and the extensive, the type,

original: ma dag pa dang dag dang mtha' //🔽rab tu dbye bas ming gi yul //
analyzed: ma dag pa dang dag dang mtha' // rab tu dbye bas ming gi yul //
translated: the impure, the pure, and the extreme.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'di shes bya'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'jug pas zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' 'di shes bya'i mtshan nyid la rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'jug pas zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Thus the Bodhisattva enters into the mere representation of the object of knowledge, and so he enters into the reality of the perfected nature.

original: der zhugs pas sa rab tu dga' ba la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: der zhugs pas sa rab tu dga' ba la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: By entering into that, he enters into the stage of the Joyful.

original: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings legs par rtogs pa yin /
translated: He comprehends the Dharma-dhâtu.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin //
translated: He is born into the family of the Tathagatas.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la sems mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la sems mnyam pa thob pa yin te /
translated: He has attained the state of mind that is the same toward all sentient beings, the state of mind that is the same toward all bodhisattvas, and the state of mind that is the same toward all buddhas.

original: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: This is his path of insight.

original: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rnam par rig pa tsam de la 'jug ce na /
translated: Why does he enter that consciousness-only?

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhi gnas gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shes pa de dang // de'i rjes las thob pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par rig pa'i shes pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa thams cad spangs nas /

translated: By means of the supramundane calm and insight that have as their object the combined dharmas, and by means of the subsequent knowledge that is the knowledge of the various representations, he abandons the seeds of the store consciousness together with their signs.

original: chos kyi sku la reg pa'i sa bon spel te /🔽gnas gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la reg pa'i sa bon spel te / gnas gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i sgo nas /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug go //
translated: Having transformed, he enters in order to attain the knowledge of a tathāgata, by means of the realization of all the buddhadharmas and the attainment of the knowledge of a tathāgata.

original: rjes la thob pa'i shes pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa thams cad rab tu skye ba dang / rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma thams cad la sgyu ma lta bu nyid la sogs par kun tu lta bas rang bzhin gyis phyin ci log par 'byung ngo //

translated: The subsequent cognition is naturally erroneous, because it always sees all the representations of the store consciousness and all the representations of the active consciousnesses as being like illusions, etc.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' de sgyu ma byas pa'i chos @25b rnams la sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa ston la yang dus thams cad du phyin ci log med pa yin no //

translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, like the magician, teaches the illusory phenomena and their causes and effects, but is never in error.

analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa'i rjes su song ba'i ting nge 'dzin te /

original: de ltar sa la zhugs te mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa bsgom pa'i lam la ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sa la zhugs te mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa bsgom pa'i lam la ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas who have entered the levels and obtained the path of seeing, who have entered mere representation, apply themselves to the path of meditation?

original: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa mdo sde thams cad bsdus pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa rnams la 'dres pa la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa mdo sde thams cad bsdus pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa rnams la 'dres pa la dmigs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang de'i rjes la thob pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi
translated: They apply themselves to the transformation of the five sense consciousnesses and the mental consciousness into the four kinds of gnosis, by means of the mundane and supramundane perfect equanimity that focuses on the combined object and the calm abiding and penetrating insight that are attained subsequently to that, in relation to the teachings on the ten levels of the bodhisattva, which are contained in all the sutras and are well established.

original: shes pas / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang por goms par byas pa'i phyir de gnas gyur nas /
analyzed: shes pas / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag mang por goms par byas pa'i phyir de gnas gyur nas /
translated: And because they have trained in that for many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, it is transformed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ro //
translated: They apply themselves to obtaining the three buddha bodies.

original: nyan thob rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na /🔽nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs la las khyad par bcus /
analyzed: nyan thob rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis bye brag ci yod ce na / nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs la las khyad par bcus /
translated: What is the difference between the clear real ization of the sravakas and the clear realization of the bodhisattvas?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par du 'phags par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The clear realization of the bodhisattva is superior to that of the sravakas in ten ways.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par ni theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar brten pa'i khyad par ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi @26a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par ni theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // nye bar brten pa'i khyad par ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi @26a * //
translated: The difference in their objects is that the bodhisattvas have a vast object, since they take as their object all beings.

original: tshogs chen pos brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs chen pos brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their support is that the bodhisattvas have a vast support, since they are supported by the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The difference in their realization is that the bodhisattvas realize the selflessness of both persons and things.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their nirvana is that the bodhisattvas take up the nirvana that does not abide in the extremes of either cyclic existence or nirvana.🔽The difference in their skill is that the bodhisattvas are skilled in the means of accomplishing all their own and others goals.

original: sa'i khyad par ni sa bcus nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: sa'i khyad par ni sa bcus nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of stage is that one definitely emerges through the ten stages.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of purification is that one abandons the instinct for affliction and purifies the buddhaverse.

original: sems can thams cad dang / bdag sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i khyad par ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang / bdag sems mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i khyad par ni sems can yongs su smin par byed par sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of the equality of self and others is that one is engaged in the maturation of beings without interruption.

original: skye ba'i khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i phyir ro //🔽skye 'byung gi khyad par ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i phyir ro // skye 'byung gi khyad par ni /
translated: The distinction of birth is that one is born in the lineage of the Tathagata.

original: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dus thams cad du skye 'byung yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du dus thams cad du skye 'byung yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of manifestation is that one manifests at all times in the circle of the assembly of the Buddha.

translated: The distinction of result is that one accomplishes the result, the infinite qualities of the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the special qualities of the Buddha.

analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: ming dang dngos gnyis phan tshun du //

translated: Name and thing are mutually

analyzed: btags pa rnam pa gnyis po la //

analyzed: de tsam nyid du btsal bar bya //

original: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas //🔽don med par ni rtog gsum dang // de med phyir yang de med par //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes pas // don med par ni rtog gsum dang // de med phyir yang de med par //

analyzed: mthong ba gsum la 'jug pa yin //

original: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni //
translated: Sees mental images

original: don gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //
analyzed: don gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //

original: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //

original: de ltar nang du sems gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar nang du sems gnas so //

analyzed: gzung ba med pa rab rtogs byos // de phyir 'dzin pa med rtogs kyis //

original: des na dmigs pa med la reg //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med la reg //

original: 'di lta ste theg pa chen po'i mdo sde'i rgyan las /

translated: Thus, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,

analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par rtogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag 'byung ba / byang chub sems dpas bsod nams ye shes kyi //
translated: Moreover, the following verses from the Abhisamayiilaf!lkara occur:🔽The Bodhisattva, having accumulated

original: tshogs rnams mtha' yas pha rol med bsags te //
analyzed: tshogs rnams mtha' yas pha rol med bsags te //
translated: The infinite collections of merit and knowledge,

analyzed: chos la sems ba legs par rnam nges phyir // don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus byung rtogs //

original: brjod pa tsam du don ni nges @26b shes nas //
analyzed: brjod pa tsam du don ni nges @26b shes nas //
translated: Having ascertained the meaning as mere expression,

original: de 'dra ba yi sems tsam nyid la gnas //🔽de bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi //
analyzed: de 'dra ba yi sems tsam nyid la gnas // de bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi //
translated: He abides in the mere mind that is like that.🔽Therefore, he directly perceives the dharmadhiitu

original: chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
translated: Free from the characteristics of duality.

original: sems las gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
analyzed: sems las gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
translated: Having understood that there is nothing other than mind,

original: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //
