original: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rtogs nas ;
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas gnyis po med rtogs nas ;
translated: The wise one, having understood the nonexistence of duality,

original: ; de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas //
analyzed: ; de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas //
translated: Abides in the dharmadhiitu that is not associated with that.🔽The wise one, having attained the state of equality

original: rtogs med shes stobs mnyam pa'i rjes song bas //
analyzed: rtogs med shes stobs mnyam pa'i rjes song bas //
translated: Through the power of understanding the absence of conceptualization,

original: blo dang ldan pas kun nas rtag par yang //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas kun nas rtag par yang //
translated: Always and completely

original: de'i gnas thibs po nyes par bsags pa sel //
analyzed: de'i gnas thibs po nyes par bsags pa sel //
translated: Its abode is the darkness, the place where evil is accumulated.

original: rtsi sman chen pos dug ni sel ba bzhin //
analyzed: rtsi sman chen pos dug ni sel ba bzhin //
translated: It is like a great medicinal plant that removes poison.

original: thub pas gsungs pa'i legs chos legs bzhag pa //
analyzed: thub pas gsungs pa'i legs chos legs bzhag pa //
translated: The good Dharma taught by the Sage is well established.🔽The root is the Dharma realm, and the mind is placed there.

original: rtsa ba chos dbyings bcas la des blo bzhag / dran rgyud ni rtog pa tsam shes nas //
analyzed: rtsa ba chos dbyings bcas la des blo bzhag / dran rgyud ni rtog pa tsam shes nas //
translated: The stream of memory, knowing mere conceptualization,

original: yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol brtan myur 'gro //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol brtan myur 'gro //
translated: crosses to the far shore of the ocean of qualities, firm and swift.

original: de ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par bstan pa la /
analyzed: de ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug par bstan pa la /
translated: Thus, having shown the engagement with the characteristics of objects of knowledge,

original: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: how should the teaching of its cause and effect be viewed?

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang drug gis 'jug go //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la ni ji ltar 'jug /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang drug gis 'jug go // pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la ni ji ltar 'jug /
translated: It is engaged by the six perfections: generosity, ethics, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.🔽How is mere representation engaged by the six perfections?

original: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag de la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag de la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ci yin zhe na /
translated: How are the six perfections the result of engagement in that?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod rnams la kun tu ma chags pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod rnams la kun tu ma chags pa /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva is not attached to enjoyments,

original: tshul khrims rnams la ltung ba med pa //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnams la ltung ba med pa //
translated: does not violate morality,

original: sdug bsngal rnams la 'khrug pa med pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams la 'khrug pa med pa /
translated: is not disturbed by suffering,

original: bsgom pa la le lo med pa /
analyzed: bsgom pa la le lo med pa /
translated: is not lazy in meditation,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu 'di dag la mi 'jug pa /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu 'di dag la mi 'jug pa /
translated: does not engage in the causes of distraction,

original: sems rtse gcig tu byas nas /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu byas nas /
translated: and having made the mind one-pointed,

original: tshul bzhin du chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du chos rnams la rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: thoroughly discerns phenomena in the correct manner.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la 'jug go //
translated: Thus, based on the six perfections, he enters into mere representation-only.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas yongs su zin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag 'thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas yongs su zin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag 'thob ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered into mere representation-only attains the six perfections embraced by pure superior intention,

original: 'di ltar 'di'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la kun tu spyod pa'i sbyor ba med kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la kun tu spyod pa'i sbyor ba med kyang /
translated: because his practice of the six perfections is not applied.

original: bstan pa la mos pa dang / ro myong ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas kyang rtag par rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstan pa la mos pa dang / ro myong ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas kyang rtag par rgyun du rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And by the mental attentions of devotion to the teaching, of relishing it, of rejoicing in it, and of delighting in it, the bodhisattvas always, continuously, and uninterruptedly complete the cultivation of the six transcendences.

original: 'dir tshigs su @27a * //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su @27a * //
translated: Here is a verse.🔽The bodhisattvas, with their completely perfected bright qualities,🔽with their keen acceptance, with their attainment, with their vehicle,

original: bcad pa / byang chub sems dpa' rnam dag gi / dkar po'i chos rnams kun rdzogs dang // bzod rnon thob dang rang gi theg / zab cing rgya che bstan pa la //
analyzed: bcad pa / byang chub sems dpa' rnam dag gi / dkar po'i chos rnams kun rdzogs dang // bzod rnon thob dang rang gi theg / zab cing rgya che bstan pa la //
translated: with their profound and magnificent teaching,

original: rtog pa tsam du rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam du rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: with their mere imagination,

original: mi rtog ye shes thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rtog ye shes thob pa'i phyir //
translated: with their attainment of nonconceptual intuition,🔽with their desire and devotion,

original: 'dod pa dang ni mos pa dag / dag pa bsam pa dag pa nyid //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ni mos pa dag / dag pa bsam pa dag pa nyid //
translated: with their purity of intention,

original: snga logs su yang chos rgyun der //
analyzed: snga logs su yang chos rgyun der //
translated: with their previous practice of the perfections,

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni mthong bas na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mthong bas na //
translated: with their seeing the buddhas in the stream of the teaching,

original: byang chub nye bar rtogs gyur nas //
analyzed: byang chub nye bar rtogs gyur nas //
translated: with their realization of the nearness of enlightenment,

original: tshegs med par ni thob phyir ro //
analyzed: tshegs med par ni thob phyir ro //
translated: and with their attainment without difficulty.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis ni rnam pa brgyad kyis lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis ni rnam pa brgyad kyis lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: These verses show the whole character of the pure will to be generous in eight aspects:

original: tshogs dang / bzod pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / gnyen po dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang / phan yon gyis te /
analyzed: tshogs dang / bzod pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / gnyen po dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang / rtags dang / phan yon gyis te /
translated: in terms of the group, of patience, of objective, of mental disposition, of counteractives, of its own character, of signs, and of benefits.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i rtsa ba rnams dang go rims bzhin du sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as corresponding to the root verses in order.

original: de dag grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid dang // go rims nges tshig goms byas yon tan dang // rab tu dbye dang bsdu dang mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: de dag grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid dang // go rims nges tshig goms byas yon tan dang // rab tu dbye dang bsdu dang mi mthun phyogs //
translated: Their number, their character, their order, their definitions, their cultivation, their qualities,🔽their divisions, their combinations, their resistances,

original: yon tan phan tshun rnam nges shes par bya //
analyzed: yon tan phan tshun rnam nges shes par bya //
translated: their qualities, and their mutual determinations should be understood.

original: ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug kho na zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug kho na zhe na /
translated: Why are there just six perfections?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas drug nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas drug nyid do //
translated: There are six perfections because they are the basis for the establishment of the adverse and the counteragent, the basis for the establishment of all the qualities of a Buddha, and the basis for the development of all beings.

original: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of giving and the perfection of morality are the counteragents to the causes of non-distinction.

original: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu ni longs spyod la chags pa dang / khyim la chags pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phags pa'i rgyu ni longs spyod la chags pa dang / khyim la chags pa'o //
translated: The causes of non-distinction are: attachment to wealth and attachment to home.

original: spangs pa ldog pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa ldog pa'i rgyu'i gnyen por bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of patience and the perfection of vigour are the counteragents to the causes of turning back.

original: ldog pa'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i sems can log par sgrub pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yun ring por dkar po'i phyogs la sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu ni 'khor ba'i sems can log par sgrub pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yun ring por dkar po'i phyogs la sbyor bas yongs su skyo ba'o //
translated: The causes of turning back are: suffering arising from the wrong practice of beings in the lifecycle and weariness due to the long period of application to the side of virtue.

original: spangs nas mi ldog pa'i chud za ba'i rgyu'i gnyen por bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: spangs nas mi ldog pa'i chud za ba'i rgyu'i gnyen por bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the cause of loss, which is to abandon the transcendent perfections and not to revert to them, is transcendent concentration and transcendent wisdom.

original: chud za ba'i rgyu ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: chud za ba'i rgyu ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab bo //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration and the perfection of wisdom are the antidotes to the cause of loss, which is distraction and false wisdom.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen pos grangs rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen pos grangs rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the perfections are established in number according to their resistances and their counteragents.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng @27b ba'i rgyu la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi g-yeng ba gcig 'grub bo //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng @27b ba'i rgyu la pha rol tu phyin pa bzhis pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi g-yeng ba gcig 'grub bo //
translated: The four perfections, beginning with energy, are the cause of nondistraction.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba de la brten nas chos kyi de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba de la brten nas chos kyi de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: By means of the perfection of nondistraction, one accomplishes the perfection of the realization of reality just as it is.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub bo //
translated: By means of the perfection of the realization of reality just as it is, one accomplishes the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis grangs drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis grangs drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the perfections are established in number according to their bases, which are the accomplishments of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan 'dod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la phan 'dod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can la gnod pa mi byed pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa dang /
translated: The perfection of generosity is the desire to benefit sentient beings; the perfection of morality is the non-harming of sentient beings; the perfection of patience is the indifference to harm;

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya bas byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bya bas byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: the perfection of effort is the performance of duties;🔽and the perfection of concentration is the non-distraction of mind.

original: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu 'di dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu 'di dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i las su rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By these five causes of benefit, sentient beings become fit for the work of being brought to maturity.

original: de'i 'og tu sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams par bya ba rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams par bya ba rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, in order to liberate those whose minds are not concentrated and those whose minds are concentrated, they are instructed.

original: de ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas grangs rnams par gzhag par blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pas grangs rnams par gzhag par blta'o //
translated: Thus, the order of the perfections should be understood as being in accordance with the bringing of all sentient beings to maturity.

original: 'o na 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ji ltar blta zhen //
analyzed: 'o na 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ji ltar blta zhen //
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: dam pa drug gis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa drug gis blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen as having six excellences:

original: gnas dam pa ni byang chub kyi sems gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dam pa ni byang chub kyi sems gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The excellence of basis, because the thought of awakening is the basis.

original: dngos po dam pa ni mtha' dag kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dam pa ni mtha' dag kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The excellence of entity, because it is practiced in all its aspects.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i ched du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i ched du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The excellence of aim, because it aims at the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The excellence of means, because it is held by nonconceptual intuition.

original: yongs su bsngo ba dam pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba dam pa ni /
translated: The excellence of dedication,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dedicated to supreme enlightenment.

original: rnam par dag pa dam pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dam pa ni /
translated: The excellence of purification,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas sgrib pa med par yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin nam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas sgrib pa med par yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro // sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin nam /
translated: because it is accomplished without the obscurations of the addictive and objective.🔽Is every generosity a perfection?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is every perfection a generosity?

original: sbyin pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa yin la /
translated: There is giving that is not a perfection.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod ces bya ba mu bzhi'o //
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: sbyin pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mu bzhi ci rigs su blta bar bya'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi go rims @28a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lhag ma rnams la yang mu bzhi ci rigs su blta bar bya'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi go rims @28a * //
translated: The remaining perfections should be understood in the same way as giving, according to the appropriateness of the alternatives.

original: 'di ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the perfections arranged in this order?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma rnams de'i phyi ma 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa snga ma rnams de'i phyi ma 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each subsequent perfection is to be practiced in dependence on the preceding perfection, and because each subsequent perfection is more sublime than the preceding one.

original: 'di dag gi nges pa'i tshig ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi nges pa'i tshig ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should one understand their verbal roots?

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba thams cad las phul du byung bar pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba thams cad las phul du byung bar pha rol tu 'gro ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: They are called perfections because they go to the other side, i.e., to the opposite side beyond all the virtues of mundane persons, Sravakas, and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: ser sna dang dbul ba 'joms pa dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bsod nams kyis tshogs thob par byed pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna dang dbul ba 'joms pa dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bsod nams kyis tshogs thob par byed pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving is the giving that destroys stinginess and poverty and brings about the attainment of great resources and the accumulation of merit.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pas tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa dang / bde 'gro dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pas tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the cause of the pacification of bad destinies and the attainment of good destinies and meditative concentration.

original: khro ba dang 'khon pa zad par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag la bde bar byed pas bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang 'khon pa zad par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan dag la bde bar byed pas bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the cause of the pacification of anger and enmity and the happiness of oneself and others.

original: le lo dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos tshad med pa rnam par spel ba mthar phyin par byed pas brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: le lo dang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang bral bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i chos tshad med pa rnam par spel ba mthar phyin par byed pas brtson 'grus so //
translated: Exertion is the cause of the elimination of laziness and sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas and the increase and completion of immeasurable virtuous dharmas.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba sel ba dang / nang du sems gnas pa sgrub par byed pas bsam gtan no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba sel ba dang / nang du sems gnas pa sgrub par byed pas bsam gtan no //
translated: Meditative concentration is the cause of the elimination of distraction and the accomplishment of mental stability.

original: lta bar gyur ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab thams cad sel ba dang / yang dag par rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams rab tu shes pas shes rab bo //
analyzed: lta bar gyur ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab thams cad sel ba dang / yang dag par rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams rab tu shes pas shes rab bo //
translated: Wisdom is the cause of the elimination of all false views and faulty wisdom and the thorough knowledge of all aspects of the dharmas.

original: 'di dag sgom pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag sgom pa ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one view the cultivation of these perfections?

original: mdor bsdu na sgom pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sgom pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, meditation should be understood as fivefold:

original: kun tu spyod pa la spyod pa la sbyor ba sgom pa dang / mos pa sgom pa dang / yid la byed pa sgom pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa sgom pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa la spyod pa la sbyor ba sgom pa dang / mos pa sgom pa dang / yid la byed pa sgom pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa sgom pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa sgom pa'o //
translated: meditation of application to the practice of universal vehicle conduct, meditation of aspiration, meditation of mental attention, meditation of skill in means, and meditation of performance of action.

original: de la sgom pa bzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sgom pa bzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The first four meditations are as previously explained.

original: bya ba sgrub pa sgom pa ni //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa sgom pa ni //
translated: Meditation of performance of action is

original: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa lhun gyi grub pa rgyun mi gcod pa na /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mdzad pa lhun gyi grub pa rgyun mi gcod pa na / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshe /
translated: when the buddhas, without any effort, perform their deeds without interruption,🔽when they perfect the transcendences,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'o //
translated: then they meditate on the transcendences.

original: yid la byed pa sgom pa ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa sgom pa ni /
translated: Meditation of mental attention is

original: ro myong ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / rgyun ring po'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: ro myong ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa dang / mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa dang / rgyun ring po'i bsam pa dang / dga' ba'i bsam pa dang / phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: mental attention to enjoyment, to congratulation, to delight, to insatiable aspiration, to farreaching aspiration, to joyful aspiration, to helpful aspiration, to aspiration for independence, to aspiration for the Dharma, and to aspiration for the three jewels.

original: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pas sgom pa'o //
analyzed: che ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pas sgom pa'o //
translated: It is meditation that is embraced by six kinds of attitude: the attitude of greatness, the attitude of virtue, and the attitude of the three kinds of patience.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med pa ji snyed kyis /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa grangs med pa ji snyed kyis /
translated: Even if a bodhisattva were to attain complete enlightenment for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges,

original: bla na med pa yang dag @28b par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de snyed kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu byas pa'i skad cig re re la bdag gi lus thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis so sor bkang ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag @28b par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba de snyed kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu byas pa'i skad cig re re la bdag gi lus thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rin po che sna bdun gyis so sor bkang ste /
translated: he or she would not be satisfied with giving away his or her whole body in every instant of every single day for that length of time, or with filling as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges with the seven kinds of jewels and offering them to the tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbul bas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dbul bas /
translated: or with practicing generosity for that length of time.

original: byang chub kyis snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i bsam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: byang chub kyis snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i bsam par 'gyur la /
translated: The bodhisattva’s attitude of generosity is to be insatiable in these three ways until he or she is seated on the seat of enlightenment.

original: dus de srid kho nar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang bar skad cig re re la spyod lam bzhi byed cing /
analyzed: dus de srid kho nar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang bar skad cig re re la spyod lam bzhi byed cing /
translated: For that long, in each instant, he practices the four modes of activity while the trichiliocosm is completely filled with fire.

original: yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan yang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sems mngon du byed de /🔽byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang ; shes rab kyi bsam par 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan yang tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi sems mngon du byed de / byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang ; shes rab kyi bsam par 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Even without all the necessities, he manifests the mind of morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.🔽Until he is seated at the site of awakening, this insatiable attitude is the bodhisattva’s attitude of morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom. This is the bodhisattva’s insatiable attitude.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa de mi 'dor ba 'di ni de'i rgyun ring po'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa de mi 'dor ba 'di ni de'i rgyun ring po'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon this insatiable attitude until he is seated at the site of awakening. This is his far-reaching attitude.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can la phan btags pas shin tu dga' ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis sems can la phan btags pas shin tu dga' ba yin gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva is very happy to help beings with the six perfections,

original: phan btags pa des sems can rnams ni de lta ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: phan btags pa des sems can rnams ni de lta ma yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: but beings are not like that in their help to him. This is the bodhisattva's attitude of joy.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis phan btags pa'i sems can de dag thams cad ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs pa yin par mthong gi /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis phan btags pa'i sems can de dag thams cad ni bdag la shin tu phan 'dogs pa yin par mthong gi /
translated: The bodhisattva sees all those beings whom he helps with the six perfections as being of great service to him,

original: bdag ni sems can de dag la de lta ma yin par mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can de dag la de lta ma yin par mthong ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i phan 'dogs pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: but he does not see himself as being of such service to them. This is the bodhisattva's attitude of helpfulness.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa sems can rnams la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnams par smin par yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa sems can rnams la 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnams par smin par yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's magnanimous attitude is that by which he dedicates the results of the evolution of the roots of virtue accumulated through the six perfections to sentient beings, as desired.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par @29a * //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' de de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te / bla na med pa yang dag par @29a * //
translated: The bodhisattva's virtuous attitude is that by which he makes common cause with all sentient beings in regard to the roots of virtue accumulated through the six perfections,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba 'di ni /
translated: and dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa ste bsam pa drug po 'di dag gis yongs su zin pa'i ro myong ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa ste bsam pa drug po 'di dag gis yongs su zin pa'i ro myong ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
translated: These are the six attitudes with which one should cultivate the attention of relishing the roots of virtue.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' de bsam pa drug sgom pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dpag tu med pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' de bsam pa drug sgom pa la sogs pa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan dpag tu med pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de la rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva rejoices in the roots of virtue of other bodhisattvas who are engaged in the practice of the six thoughts and so on.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' pa bsam drug gis yongs su zin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' pa bsam drug gis yongs su zin pa'i rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva cultivates the mental attention of rejoicing, which is embraced by the six thoughts.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' de sems can thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa dang / bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom pa la brtson pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa la /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpa' de sems can thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa dang / bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgom pa la brtson pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa la /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva delights in the practice of the six perfections by all sentient beings, embraced by the six thoughts, and in his own practice of the six perfections, embraced by the six thoughts.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: He delights in them up to the seat of awakening.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa'i mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa'i mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa sgom mo //
translated: Thus the bodhisattva cultivates the mental attention of delight, which is embraced by the six thoughts.

original: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa'i sgom pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa 'di thos nas /
analyzed: gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i yid la byed pa'i sgom pa bsam pa drug gis yongs su zin pa 'di thos nas /
translated: Those who, having heard this meditation on the mental orientation of the bodhisattva, which is embraced by the six thoughts,

original: dang ba'i sems gcig kyang skyed pa de dag bsod nams tshad med pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems gcig kyang skyed pa de dag bsod nams tshad med pa skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: generate even a single thought of faith will generate immeasurable merit,

original: nyes pa byas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang bshig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang bshig par 'gyur na /
translated: and will destroy all the obscurations created by their misdeeds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to speak of the bodhisattvas?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should one view the classification of these perfections?

original: de ni rnam pa gsum gsum du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum gsum du blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be viewed as threefold:

original: chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims dang / gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang /
translated: the generosity of Dharma, the generosity of material things, and the generosity of protection; the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings; the patience of accepting suffering, the patience of not being upset by harm done by others, and the patience of being certain about phenomena;

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dang / go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi zhum zhing mi 'khrugs pa la chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gnas pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dang / go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi zhum zhing mi 'khrugs pa la chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus dang / gnas pa dang /
translated: effort that is not discouraged or disturbed, concentration that is the basis,🔽concentration that is the accomplishment, concentration that accomplishes what is to be done,

original: mngon par sgrub pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par mi rtog par sbyor ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i shes rab @29b po ;
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par mi rtog par sbyor ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i shes rab @29b po ;
translated: wisdom that is applied without conceptualization, wisdom that is without conceptualization, and wisdom that is attained after the absence of conceptualization.

original: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should these be seen as included?

original: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad de'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang mthun pa dang / de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad de'i mtshan nyid dang / de dang mthun pa dang / de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all virtuous dharmas are included in their characteristics, their concordance, and their results.

original: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar bsdus par blta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad ji ltar bsdus par blta zhe na /
translated: How should all the afflictions be seen as included in their counteragents?

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i gzhi dang / de'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang / de'i gzhi dang / de'i 'bras bus so //
translated: by its characteristics, by its basis, and by its result.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi phan yon ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi phan yon ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the benefits of these perfections be understood?

original: 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
translated: When transmigrating in cyclic existence,

original: dbang phyug bsdus pa dang / chen por skye ba bsdus pa dang / phyogs gang dang g-yog 'khor chen po bsdus pa dang / las kyi mtha' chen po la sbyor ba 'grub pas yongs su bzung ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba yongs su bzung ba dang /
analyzed: dbang phyug bsdus pa dang / chen por skye ba bsdus pa dang / phyogs gang dang g-yog 'khor chen po bsdus pa dang / las kyi mtha' chen po la sbyor ba 'grub pas yongs su bzung ba dang / gnod pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa chung ba yongs su bzung ba dang /
translated: the bodhisattvas take up the benefit of the collection of lordliness, the collection of great births, the collection of great retinues and followers, and the collection of great accomplishments in the performance of actions; they take up the benefit of non-violence and the benefit of little defilement;

original: bzo dang / bstan bcos dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yongs su bzung ba dang / mngon par mtho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan yon no //
analyzed: bzo dang / bstan bcos dang / rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa yongs su bzung ba dang / mngon par mtho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du sems can thams cad kyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phan yon no //
translated: they take up the benefit of skill in all the arts, treatises, and sciences; they take up the benefit of the irreproachability of high status; and they take up the benefit of being ready to work for the welfare of all sentient beings until they are established in the essence of enlightenment.

original: 'di dag gi phan tshun rnams par nges pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi phan tshun rnams par nges pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should one view their mutual determination?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis la lar ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sbyin pa'i sgrar bstan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis la lar ni pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sbyin pa'i sgrar bstan /
translated: The Lord has taught that in some places all the perfections are the word for giving.

original: la lar ni tshul khrims kyi sgra bstan //🔽la lar ni bzod pa'i sgrar bstan /
analyzed: la lar ni tshul khrims kyi sgra bstan // la lar ni bzod pa'i sgrar bstan /
translated: In some places he has taught that they are the word for morality.🔽In some places he has taught that they are the word for patience.

original: la lar ni brtson 'grus kyi sgrar bstan /
analyzed: la lar ni brtson 'grus kyi sgrar bstan /
translated: In some places he has taught that they are the word for effort.

original: la lar ni bsam gtan gyi sgrar bstan /
analyzed: la lar ni bsam gtan gyi sgrar bstan /
translated: In some places he has taught that they are the word for meditation.

original: la lar ni shes rab kyi sgrar bstan pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: la lar ni shes rab kyi sgrar bstan pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: In some places he has taught that they are the word for wisdom. What is the intention in that?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la sbyor ba na /
translated: When one is engaged in all the perfections,

original: 'di dag thams cad kyi spyod pa 'gro ba las dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyi spyod pa 'gro ba las dgongs pa'o //
translated: the intention is to show that all of them are included in each one.

original: de ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes bya'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the cause and effect of engaging the characteristics of the knowable,

original: de sgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de sgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: how should one view the divisions of its cultivation?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams su blta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rnams su blta ste /
translated: It should be viewed in the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: And what are they?

original: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba tsan dang / shin tu sbyong dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba tsan dang / shin tu sbyong dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: Joyful, stainless, luminous, radiant, very difficult to master, manifest, far-reaching, immovable, excellent understanding,

original: chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin no //
translated: and cloud of Dharma.

original: 'di dag bcu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag bcu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should these be viewed as being tenfold?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rigs pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen po'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rigs pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen po'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the antidotes to the ten kinds of non-reason that are their opposites.

original: 'di ltar shes bya chos kyi dbyings @30a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes bya chos kyi dbyings @30a * //
translated: Thus, the ten aspects of the knowable, the Dharma-element,

original: rnam pa bcu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa rnam pa bcu nyid gnas so //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa rnam pa bcu nyid gnas so //
translated: are the ten kinds of nescience that are their opposites.

original: shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the ten aspects of the knowable, the Dharma-element?

original: sa dang po la ni kun tu 'gro ba'i don du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la ni kun tu 'gro ba'i don du shes par bya'o //
translated: On the first stage, it is to be known as having the meaning of omnipresence.

original: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du'o //
translated: On the second, it is to be known as having the meaning of supremacy.

original: gsum pa la ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu'o //
translated: On the third, it is to have the meaning of the supremacy of the cause of the natural outcome.

original: bzhi pa la ni yongs su bzung ba ma yin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yongs su bzung ba ma yin pa'i don du'o //
translated: On the fourth, it is the meaning of non-appropriation.

original: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du'o //
translated: On the fifth, it is the meaning of non-differentiation of continuum.

original: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i don du'o //
translated: On the sixth, it is the meaning of non-defilement and non-purification.

original: bdun pa la ni chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la ni chos sna tshogs tha dad pa med pa'i don du'o //
translated: On the seventh, it is the meaning of non-differentiation of the various dharmas.

original: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing lhag pa med pa'i don dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing lhag pa med pa'i don dang / mtshan ma la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du'o //
translated: On the eighth, it is the meaning of non-decrease and non-increase, the meaning of the basis of mastery over signs, and the meaning of the basis of mastery over fields.

original: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du'o //
translated: On the ninth, it is the meaning of the basis of mastery over intuition.

original: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i gnas kyi don du shes par bya'o ;
translated: On the tenth, it should be known as the meaning of the basis of mastery over action, and the meaning of the basis of mastery over the dhāraṇī and meditative absorption gates.

original: ;'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: ;'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: kun tu 'gro don mchog gi don //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro don mchog gi don //
translated: The universal meaning, the supreme meaning,

original: rgyu mthun don gyi mchog nyid dang // yongs su 'dzin pa don med dang // rgyud rnams tha dad med pa dang // nyon mongs rnam dag med don dang // tha dad med pa'i don nyid dang // bri med 'phel ba med don dang // dbang ni rnam pa bzhi yi gnas //🔽chos kyi dbyings la ma rig pa //
analyzed: rgyu mthun don gyi mchog nyid dang // yongs su 'dzin pa don med dang // rgyud rnams tha dad med pa dang // nyon mongs rnam dag med don dang // tha dad med pa'i don nyid dang // bri med 'phel ba med don dang // dbang ni rnam pa bzhi yi gnas // chos kyi dbyings la ma rig pa //
translated: and the meaning of the four masteries.

original: nyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu /🔽sa bcu'i mi mthun phyogs rnams kyi //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu / sa bcu'i mi mthun phyogs rnams kyi //
translated: The ten obscurations to the ten perfections🔽are the obscurations to the ten spiritual levels.🔽The ten obscurations to the ten spiritual levels

original: gnyen po dag ni sa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dag ni sa yin no //
translated: are the counteragents to the ten perfections.

original: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this nescience is not defiled for the Sravakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni nyon mongs pa can du rig par bya'o //
translated: but it is defiled for the Bodhisattvas.

original: ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the first spiritual level called the Joyful One?

original: des thog ma kho nar bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thog ma kho nar bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub nus pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, for the first time, one obtains the ability to accomplish one's own and others' goals.

original: ci'i phyir sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the second stage called the Immaculate?

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is far removed from the stain of immorality.

original: ci'i phyir sa gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa gsum pa 'od byed pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the third stage called the Radiant?

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas yin pas chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa nyams pa med pa'i gnas yin pas chos kyi snang ba chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the great light of the Dharma, since it is the basis for the nondegeneration of meditative concentration and meditative attainment.

original: ci'i phyir sa bzhin pa 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bzhin pa 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the fourth stage called the Brilliant?

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis sgrib pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis sgrib pa thams cad sreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it burns up all obscurations by means of the factors of enlightenment.

original: ci'i phyir sa @30b lnga pa shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa @30b lnga pa shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the fifth stage called Hard to Conquer?

original: bden pa dang 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pas de bsgrub dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang 'jig rten pa'i shes pa gnyis phan tshun mi mthun pas de bsgrub dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to attain for those who are attached to the two, for the knowledge of the truths and mundane knowledge are mutually incompatible.

original: ci'i phyir sa drug pa mngon du gyur zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa drug pa mngon du gyur zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the sixth stage called the Facing?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i gnas yin pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i gnas yin pas /
translated: because it is the basis for the knowledge of dependent origination.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir sa bdun pa la ring du song ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bdun pa la ring du song ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the seventh stage called the Far-reaching?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the culmination of the practice of application.

original: ci'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the eighth stage called the Unshakable?

original: mtshan ma dang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unshaken by all signs and all constructive thoughts.

original: ci'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the ninth stage called the Excellent Wisdom?

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i shes pa dang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the first attainment of the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.

original: ci'i phyir sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the tenth stage called the Cloud of Truth?

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos thams cad shes pa gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad khong na yod pa sprin lta bus nam mkha' ltar rgya che ba'i sgrib pa khebs pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i chos thams cad shes pa gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad khong na yod pa sprin lta bus nam mkha' ltar rgya che ba'i sgrib pa khebs pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattva who has attained the stage of direct intuition devoid of conceptual differentiation is like space, because it is the cause of the attainment of the Dharma Body.

original: sa 'di dag thob pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'di dag thob pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is the attainment of these stages?

original: rnam pa bzhis blta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis blta ste /
translated: It should be seen as being fourfold:

original: mos pa thob pas ni sa la mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa thob pas ni sa la mos pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: attainment through faith, because of the very faith in the stage;

original: spyod pa thob pas ni sa dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa thob pas ni sa dang rab tu ldan pa'i chos spyod pa bcu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: attainment through practice, because of the attainment of the ten practices which are associated with the stage;

original: rtogs pa thob pas ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rtogs nas thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa thob pas ni sa dang po la chos kyi dbyings rtogs nas thams cad rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: attainment through realization, because of the realization of all the stages after the realization of the universal Dharma realm on the first stage;

original: 'grub par thob pas ni sa 'di dag gi sgom pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub par thob pas ni sa 'di dag gi sgom pa'i mthar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: attainment through accomplishment, because of the accomplishment of the culmination of the meditative development of these stages.

original: sa 'di dag gi sgom pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: sa 'di dag gi sgom pa ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should the meditative development of these stages be seen?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sa dang sa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sa dang sa la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong sgom pa na /
translated: Here, when bodhisattvas cultivate serenity and insight on the various levels,

original: rnam pa lngas sgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas sgom ste /
translated: they do so in five ways.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dres par sgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / lhun gyis grub par sgom pa dang / 'bar bar sgom pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pas so //
analyzed: 'dres par sgom pa dang / mtshan ma med par sgom pa dang / lhun gyis grub par sgom pa dang / 'bar bar sgom pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin par sgom pas so //
translated: meditative cultivation that is combined, meditative cultivation that is free of signs, meditative cultivation that is spontaneous, meditative cultivation that is powerful, and meditative cultivation that is insatiable.

original: sgom pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu lnga mngon par 'grub par byed de /
analyzed: sgom pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu lnga mngon par 'grub par byed de /
translated: These five types of meditative cultivation bring about the accomplishment of five fruits for bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ltar skad cig re re la gnas ngan len rnams kyis gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig re re la gnas ngan len rnams kyis gnas thams cad 'jig par byed pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral te /
translated: Thus, in each instant, they destroy all the negative tendencies that are present in the mind and they eliminate the various kinds of conceptual thoughts.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba thams cad du tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dag par shes pa dang / rnam par ma brtags par rnam @31a * //
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob pa dang / chos kyi snang ba thams cad du tshad med cing rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa yang dag par shes pa dang / rnam par ma brtags par rnam @31a * //
translated: He obtains delight in the delight of Dharma, and he correctly knows the infinite and unhampered aspects of all the lights of Dharma.

original: par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan mar rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan mar rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba dang / chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: He does not imagine the signs of the stage of purification that is not yet fully purified, and he acquires the causes for the higher and higher perfection and completion of the body of Dharma.

original: gtsor na sa bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtsor na sa bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgom par 'gyur te /
translated: In the ten stages, he cultivates the ten perfections.

original: drug tu ni drug ji skad du bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: drug tu ni drug ji skad du bstan pa rnams so //
translated: In six stages, he cultivates the six perfections as they have been taught.

original: phyi ma bzhir ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: phyi ma bzhir ni bzhi ste /
translated: In the last four stages, he cultivates the last four perfections.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of skillful means is in the seventh stage.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //🔽smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro // smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of aspiration is the cause of the perfection of power, because one accumulates the roots of virtue in common with all beings by means of the six perfections, and dedicates them to supreme enlightenment.

original: phyi ma la smon lam sna tshogs mngon par bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: phyi ma la smon lam sna tshogs mngon par bsgrubs pas /
translated: The perfection of aspiration is the cause of the perfection of power, because one accumulates the conditions for the perfections by means of the various aspirations accomplished in the future.🔽The perfection of power is the cause of the perfection of wisdom, because one practices the six perfections uninterruptedly by means of the power of discernment and the power of meditation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rkyen sdud pa'i phyir ro //🔽stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rkyen sdud pa'i phyir ro // stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
