original: so sor rtog pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rgyun mi 'chad par kun tu spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the cause of the perfection of the renuncia­tions, because one renounces the six perfections in order to avoid all the obstacles.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rnam par 'jog pa ste /🔽ye shes kyis chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag rnam par 'jog pa ste /🔽ye shes kyis chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pa thams cad sgom par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pa thams cad sgom par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that the four perfections are not cultivated in the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos kyi shes kyis bsdus par blta'o //
analyzed: chos kyi shes kyis bsdus par blta'o //
translated: They should be seen as included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sgom par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sa thams cad du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sgom par mi 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the perfections are not cultivated on all the stages.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that Dharma discourse is included in the basket of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dus ji srid cig gis sa bcu po 'di dag gi sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gis sa bcu po 'di dag gi sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In what time are the cultivations of these ten stages completed?

original: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The five individuals complete them in three incalculable eons.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i gang zag ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i gang zag ni bskal pa grangs med pa dang pos rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The individual on the stage of action in faith completes them in the first incalculable eon.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la spyod pa mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dag ni sa drug po dag dang / bdun pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa la spyod pa mtshan ma la spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med pa la spyod pa dag ni sa drug po dag dang / bdun pa la bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis pas rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices with a pure superior intention, whether practicing with signs or practicing without signs, perfects the first two incalculable eons on the first six stages and the seventh stage.

original: de nyid mngon par 'du byed par spyod pa ni //
analyzed: de nyid mngon par 'du byed par spyod pa ni //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices with manifest activity

original: de yan chad sa bcu'i bar du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yan chad sa bcu'i bar du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: perfects the third incalculable eon from the eighth stage up to the tenth stage.

original: 'dir tshigs su @31b bcad pa //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su @31b bcad pa //
translated: Here is a verse:🔽The bodhisattva who is good, powerful in vows,

original: bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang / sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang / sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba yi //
translated: firm in mind, and progressing in a special way🔽is said to undertake

original: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa gsum //🔽kun tu rtsom pa mdzad ces brjod //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa gsum // kun tu rtsom pa mdzad ces brjod //
translated: the three incalculable eons.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu sgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu sgom pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the classification of the cultivation of cause and effect,

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: how should one view the distinctive excellence of superior morality?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa las byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Bodhisattva Stages' Compendium of Determinations says,

original: mdor bsdu na khyad par bzhis khyad par du blta ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khyad par bzhis khyad par du blta ste /
translated: In brief, the difference is to be seen in four differences:

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / bslab pa thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang / rgya che ba nyid kyi khyad par dang / zab pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du blta'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang / bslab pa thun mong dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i khyad par dang / rgya che ba nyid kyi khyad par dang / zab pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du blta'o //
translated: difference of classification, difference of common and uncommon precepts, difference of vastness, and difference of profundity.

original: de la rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par ni /
translated: The difference of classification is as follows:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi phyir ro //
translated: The morality of vow, the morality of collecting virtuous natures, and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims gnyis kyi rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims gnyis kyi rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The morality of vow is to be understood as the basis of the other two moralities.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of collecting virtuous natures is the basis of the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.🔽 The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings is the basis of the morality of vow.🔽 The difference of common and uncommon precepts is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa'i rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par 'grub pa'i rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the basis for the accomplishment of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rten gyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the basis for the development of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa nyan thos rnams dang thun mong ba ni /
translated: The training of the bodhisattvas is common to the disciples

original: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not engage in what is naturally reprehensible.

original: bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: bslab pa thun mong ma yin pa ni /
translated: The training that is not common

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa kun tu spyod pa'i phyir te /
translated: is because they do engage in what is reprehensible by decree.

original: bslab pa de la ni gang du nyan thos kyi ltung bar 'gyur ba de la byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bslab pa de la ni gang du nyan thos kyi ltung bar 'gyur ba de la byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba med do //
translated: In that training, where there is an offense for the disciples, there is no offense for the bodhisattvas.

original: gang du byang chub sems dpa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de la nyan thos kyi ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gang du byang chub sems dpa'i ltung bar 'gyur ba de la nyan thos kyi ltung ba med do //
translated: Where there is an offense for the bodhisattvas, there is no offense for the disciples.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattvas

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi'o //
translated: of body, speech, and mind.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni lus dang ngag nyid do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni lus dang ngag nyid do //
translated: The disciples have only the morality of body and speech.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyi ltung bar yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyi ltung bar yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas have a downfall of mind,

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: but the disciples do not.

original: mdor bsdu na gang kha na ma tho ba med par sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gang kha na ma tho ba med par sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las de dag thams cad byang chub sems dpa' kun tu spyad par bya'o //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva should practice all the actions of body, speech, and mind which are helpful to all beings without being offensive.

original: de la bslab par byang bya ste /
analyzed: de la bslab par byang bya ste /
translated: One should train in that.

original: de ltar na thun mong ma yin pas khyad par du blta'o /
analyzed: de ltar na thun mong ma yin pas khyad par du blta'o /
translated: Thus, it is seen to be distinctive in its universality.

original: @32a * // rgya che ba nyid kyi khyad par ni rgya che ba nyid rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
analyzed: @32a * // rgya che ba nyid kyi khyad par ni rgya che ba nyid rnam pa bzhi'i phyir te /
translated: The distinctive superiority of its magnanimity is due to four kinds of magnanimity.

original: sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bslab pa rgya che ba nyid dang / bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa rgya che ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa rgya che ba nyid dang /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bslab pa rgya che ba nyid dang / bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa rgya che ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa rgya che ba nyid dang /
translated: It is vast in terms of the manifold and immeasurable trainings, vast in terms of embracing immeasurable merit, vast in terms of embracing the intention to bring benefit and happiness to all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brten pa rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brten pa rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and vast in terms of being based on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de la zab pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams de lta bus srog gcod pa la pa sogs pa'i las rnam pa bcu spyod kyang /
analyzed: de la zab pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa rnams de lta bus srog gcod pa la pa sogs pa'i las rnam pa bcu spyod kyang /
translated: Here, the profound is when bodhisattvas skilled in means engage in the ten actions such as killing,

original: des kha na ma tho bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des kha na ma tho bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: but it does not become a misdeed,

original: bsod nams tshad med pa yang skyed cing /
analyzed: bsod nams tshad med pa yang skyed cing /
translated: immeasurable merit is produced,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang myur du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: and they quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yang sprul pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang /
analyzed: yang sprul pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the emanated body and verbal actions

original: byang chub sems dpa'i zab pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i zab pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as the bodhisattva’s profound morality.

original: des rgyal srid kyang byed cing /
analyzed: des rgyal srid kyang byed cing /
translated: Even while ruling a kingdom,

original: sems can rnams la gtse ba sna tshogs bstan nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gtse ba sna tshogs bstan nas /
translated: he may manifest various kinds of harm to sentient beings,

original: sems can 'dul ba'i yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'grub par byed de /🔽'di ni gzhan la gnod pa bya bas /🔽de las gzhan pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa kun tu ston pas /🔽gzhan dag sems dang pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'grus par byed de /
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba'i yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'grub par byed de / 'di ni gzhan la gnod pa bya bas / de las gzhan pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa kun tu ston pas / gzhan dag sems dang pa sngon du 'gro ba'i yongs su smin par bya ba yang 'grus par byed de /
translated: but he accomplishes the evolutionary development of sentient beings to be disciplined.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims zab pa nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims zab pa nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s morality of profundity.

original: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa 'di bzhis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa khyad par can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na khyad par rnam pa 'di bzhis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa khyad par can du rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva’s morality should be understood as distinctive in four ways:

original: rab tu dbye ba 'dis na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med de /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'dis na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med de /
translated: By these distinctions, the bodhisattva’s training is infinitely distinguished.

original: dper na 'dul bar bsnyad pa shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba lta bu'o /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dul bar bsnyad pa shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las 'byung ba lta bu'o / // / bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: For example, it is like what appears in the Vinaya and the Vaipulya Sutras.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the distinctive vows of superior morality,

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: how should one view the distinctive superior mind?

original: mdor bsdu na rab tu dbye ba drug gis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rab tu dbye ba drug gis blta bar bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be viewed through six categories:

original: dmigs pas rab tu dbye ba dang / sna tshogs nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba dang / las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon par sgrub pas rab tu dbye ba dang / las kyis rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pas rab tu dbye ba dang / sna tshogs nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba dang / las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba dang / mngon par sgrub pas rab tu dbye ba dang / las kyis rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: the classification of objective support, the classification of diversity, the classification of antidote, the classification of serviceability, the classification of achievement, and the classification of action.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos la @32b dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos la @32b dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it takes the Mahayana teachings as its objective support.

original: theg pa chen po snang ba dang / bsod nams thams cad yang dag par bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po bzang skyong dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs nyid tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po snang ba dang / bsod nams thams cad yang dag par bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po bzang skyong dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs nyid tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the light of the Great Vehicle, because of the accumulation of all merits, because of the samādhi of the king of samādhis, Bhadrapāla, and because of the various samādhis such as the heroic stride.

original: chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis ;
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis ;
translated: By the wisdom that observes the mixture of all phenomena,🔽like a child being born from a womb, the ālaya consciousness is held to be the cause of the obscurations.

original: khye'u khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sgrib pa'i gang du 'dod par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dzin rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khye'u khye'u dbyung ba'i tshul du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la sgrib pa'i gang du 'dod par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // 'dzin rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it holds the place of birth.🔽Because it accomplishes the unobstructed higher perceptions in all world systems, and because it moves, blazes, pervades, teaches, transforms into others,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / g-yo bar byed pa dang / 'bar bar byed pa dang / khyab par byed pa dang / ston pa dang / gzhan gyi dngos por bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / g-yo bar byed pa dang / 'bar bar byed pa dang / khyab par byed pa dang / ston pa dang / gzhan gyi dngos por bsgyur ba dang /
translated: and because it is the cause of the unobstructed higher perceptions in all world systems.

original: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / sdud pa dang / rgyas par byed pa dang / gzugs kyi lus thams cad 'jog pa dang / skal ba mnyam pas 'gro ba dang / snang bar byed cing mi snang bar yang byed pa dang / dbang nyid du byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba dang / sdud pa dang / rgyas par byed pa dang / gzugs kyi lus thams cad 'jog pa dang / skal ba mnyam pas 'gro ba dang / snang bar byed cing mi snang bar yang byed pa dang / dbang nyid du byed pa dang /
translated: It moves, it comes and goes, it contracts and expands, it supports the entire physical body, it moves in the same realm, it illuminates and it conceals, it dominates, it is the basis of the mind and mental factors and it is the basis of the body.🔽

original: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'jog pa dang / spobs pa dang / dran pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / 'od zer gtong ba'i rgyu 'phrul chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa thams cad bsdus pa dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'jog pa dang / spobs pa dang / dran pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa dang / 'od zer gtong ba'i rgyu 'phrul chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / dka' ba spyod pa thams cad bsdus pa dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the great magical emanations of the bodhisattvas, because it accomplishes the ten kinds of difficult acts, such as going, coming, contracting, expanding, assuming all kinds of physical forms, going with a group, making visible what is invisible, exercising power, stopping the magical powers of others, and emanating the great magical creations of giving eloquence, memory, and bliss, and sending out light rays.

original: dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten kinds of difficult acts are as follows:

original: khas blang bar dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: khas blang bar dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The difficult act of accepting is

original: byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub chen por smon lam 'debs pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the vow to achieve great enlightenment.

original: mi ldog par dka' ba spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldog par dka' ba spyod pa ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnams kyis mi bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to practice without turning back, because it is not turned back by the sufferings of cyclic existence.🔽

original: phyir mi phyogs par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: phyir mi phyogs par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of austerities that is not turned back is because of not being turned back by the sufferings of cyclic life.

original: sems can thams cad kyi log par sgrub pa rnams kyis de las phyir mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽mngon du phyogs par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi log par sgrub pa rnams kyis de las phyir mi phyogs pa'i phyir ro // mngon du phyogs par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of austerities that does not turn away is because of not turning away from them due to the ingratitude of all sentient beings.

original: gnod par byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi don thams cad bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi gos par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi don thams cad bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro // mi gos par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of austerities that is not directed is because of being directed toward the welfare of all sentient beings who are harmful.

original: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //🔽mos par dka' ba spyod pa ni /🔽rtog pa med par yang theg pa chen po la rgya che ba nyid dang / zab pa nyid thams cad la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro // mos par dka' ba spyod pa ni / rtog pa med par yang theg pa chen po la rgya che ba nyid dang / zab pa nyid thams cad la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice of austerities that is not defiled is because of not being defiled by worldly dharmas, even though one is born in the world.

original: rtogs par @33a * //🔽dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rtogs par @33a * // dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice of austerities that is not conceived is because of being conceived in the Great Vehicle, and because of being conceived in all its vastness and profundity, even without conceptualization.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice of austerities that is not realized is because of realizing the selflessness of persons and of phenomena.

original: khong du chud par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice that is difficult to understand is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa zab mo khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa zab mo khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of understanding the profound, which is the teaching of the Tathagatas that is intended to be interpreted.

original: mi 'byed pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'byed pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice that is difficult to be without differentiation and without afflictions is

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong yang /
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong yang /
translated: because of not abandoning cyclic existence

original: des kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of being without afflictions due to that.

original: sbyor bar dka' ba spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor bar dka' ba spyod pa ni /
translated: The practice that is difficult to apply is

original: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du lhun gyis grub par sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad mdzad pa dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba la bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams 'khor ba'i mtha'i bar du lhun gyis grub par sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad mdzad pa dag la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddhas, who are free from all obscurations, apply themselves to the welfare of all sentient beings until the end of cyclic existence, spontaneously and effortlessly.

original: khong du chud par dka' ba spyod pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa la /
analyzed: khong du chud par dka' ba spyod pa la sangs rgyas rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa la /
translated: As for the practice that is difficult to understand, which is the teaching of the Buddhas that is intended to be interpreted,

original: de dag gis khong du chud pa ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis khong du chud pa ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: what is the understanding of that?🔽For example, it is said:

original: dper na ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin phod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dper na ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin phod pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is a bodhisattva generous?”

original: gal te sbyin pa cung zad mi sbyin la de phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sbyin pa bya ba tshad med pa la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa cung zad mi sbyin la de phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sbyin pa bya ba tshad med pa la yang 'jug go //
translated: If one does not give even a little, but engages in the giving of the ten directions of the world, it is immeasurable.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa 'dod pa yin zhes na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa 'dod pa yin zhes na /
translated: How is it that one desires giving?

original: gal te sbyin pa thams cad la 'dod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa thams cad la 'dod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: If one does not desire all giving.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mos pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is intent on giving?

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dad pas mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la dad pas mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: If one does not go to the Tathagatas with faith.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one engages in giving?

original: gal te bdag sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag sbyin pa la 'jug par mi byed pa ste /
translated: If one does not engage in giving oneself.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis sbyin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one gives by nature.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one delights in giving?

original: gal te lan 'ga' sbyin pa ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te lan 'ga' sbyin pa ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa'o //
translated: If one does not give anything at all at any time.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la che ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la che ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is great in giving?

original: gal te sbyin pa la snying po med pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa la snying po med pa'i 'du shes su gyur pa'o //
translated: If one has the idea that giving is worthless.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is generosity pure?

original: gal te ser snang 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te ser snang 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: If it is the cause of the arising of non-avarice.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa mthar phyin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa mthar phyin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is generosity brought to perfection?

original: gal te mtha' la mi gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mtha' la mi gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: If it is not a basis for the extremes.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la bdag po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la bdag po yin zhe na /
translated: How is generosity one's own?

original: gal te sbyin pa la dbang byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa la dbang byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is not under the control of generosity.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa mi zad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa mi zad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is generosity inexhaustible?

original: gal te mi zad pa la mi gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mi zad pa la mi gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: If it is not a basis for inexhaustibility.

original: sbyin pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa shes rab la thug pa rnams la yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du tshul khrims la sogs pa shes rab la thug pa rnams la yang ci rigs su shes par bya'o //
translated: Generosity should be understood in the same way as the other perfections, from morality up to wisdom.

original: ji ltar na srog gcod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na srog gcod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is killing morally good?

original: gal te srog chags @33b rnams 'khor ba las shin tu bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gal te srog chags @33b rnams 'khor ba las shin tu bzlog pa'o //
translated: If it is the cause of the complete cessation of the life of a living being.

original: ji ltar na ma byin par len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma byin par len pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is taking what is not given morally good?

original: gal te sus kyang ma byin par bdag nyid kyis sems can thams cad len pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sus kyang ma byin par bdag nyid kyis sems can thams cad len pa'o //
translated: If it is the taking of all beings by oneself, without being given by another.

original: ji ltar na 'dod pa la log par spyod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod pa la log par spyod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a person who engages in sexual misconduct?

original: gal te 'dod pa rnams la log pa'o zhes spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa rnams la log pa'o zhes spyod pa'o //
translated: If one engages in the objects of desire as objects of desire.

original: ji ltar na brdzun du smra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brdzun du smra ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a liar?

original: gal te gang brdzun pa de la brdzun no zhes smra ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang brdzun pa de la brdzun no zhes smra ba'o //
translated: If one speaks of what is false as false.

original: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a person who has wrong views?🔽If one sees all as all.

original: gal te gang thams cad na thams cad la 'dug pa'i log pa de ji lta ba bzhin ltar na ngag rtsub po smra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gang thams cad na thams cad la 'dug pa'i log pa de ji lta ba bzhin ltar na ngag rtsub po smra ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a person who speaks harshly?

original: gal te shes bya ba'i pha rol tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gal te shes bya ba'i pha rol tu gnas pa'o //
translated: If one abides in the other side of objects of knowledge.

original: ji ltar na tshig kyal pa smras pa yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na tshig kyal pa smras pa yin zhe na ;
translated: How is one a person who speaks frivolously?

original: gal te chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par phye ste smra ba'o //
translated: If one speaks having thoroughly distinguished all phenomena.

original: ji ltar na brnab sems can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brnab sems can yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a person who has covetousness?

original: gal te rgyun du bdag bla na med pa'i bsam gtan thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rgyun du bdag bla na med pa'i bsam gtan thob par byed pa'o //
translated: If one always makes oneself attain unsurpassed meditative concentration.

original: ji ltar na gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a person who has a mind of ill will?

original: gal te sems la nyon mongs par byed pa thams cad la 'dis gnod par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems la nyon mongs par byed pa thams cad la 'dis gnod par byas pa yin no //
translated: If the mind is defiled by all the defilements, it is harmed by this.

original: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhe na /
translated: How is one a holder of wrong views?

original: gal te gang thams cad na thams cad la 'dug pa'i log pa de ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang thams cad na thams cad la 'dug pa'i log pa de ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'o //
translated: If one sees as it really is that which is wrong in all things.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Buddha’s teachings are profound.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is profound about the Buddha’s teachings?

original: 'dir bstan pa rtag pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'dir bstan pa rtag pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: Here, the teachings that are permanent are the Buddha’s teachings,

original: chos kyi sku rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma Body is permanent.

original: chad pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: chad pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The teachings that are annihilated are the Buddha’s teachings,

original: sgrib pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all obscurations are annihilated.

original: skye ba'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: skye ba'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The teachings that are born are the Buddha’s teachings,

original: sprul pa'i sku skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Emanation Body is born.

original: dmigs pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The teachings that are objects are the Buddha’s teachings,🔽because the Enjoyment Body is an object.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po dag dang bcad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dod chags dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen po dag dang bcad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: because they are the antidotes to the eighty-four thousand kinds of conduct of living beings, and because they are the means of eliminating them.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The dharmas with passion are the Buddha dharmas.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems can rnams kyis bdag tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems can rnams kyis bdag tu khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because living beings with passion have accepted the self.

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: Similarly, the dharmas with hatred are the Buddha dharmas.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos /🔽so so'i skye ba'o chos rnams ni /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos / so so'i skye ba'o chos rnams ni /
translated: The dharmas with delusion are the Buddha dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su blta bar bya'o //🔽mi gos pa'i chos rnams ni @34a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su blta bar bya'o // mi gos pa'i chos rnams ni @34a * //
translated: The dharmas of the ordinary man are to be seen as the Buddha dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas kyis chos rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis chos rnams te /
translated: The unsoiled dharmas are the Buddha dharmas.

original: grub pa'i de bzhin nyid la sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar gos pa med pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: grub pa'i de bzhin nyid la sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir ro // nye bar gos pa med pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: Because in the suchness of accomplishment all obscurations are unsoiled.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te /
translated: The dharmas without soiling are the Buddha dharmas.

original: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyis nye bar gos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten du skyes kyang 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams kyis nye bar gos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although born in the world, he is not defiled by worldly dharmas.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis chos rnams ni zab pa zhes bya'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / sems can yongs su smin bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyis chos rnams ni zab pa zhes bya'o // pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / sems can yongs su smin bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the dharmas of the Buddha are called profound.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi las kyi rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi las kyi rab tu dbye bar blta'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s samādhis should be understood as having the function of cultivating the perfections, of bringing beings to maturity, of purifying the buddhaverse, and of accomplishing all the buddha dharmas.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i sems kyi khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the excellence of superior mind,

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: how should the excellence of superior wisdom be seen?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / gzhi dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / rten dang ; grogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid dang / gnas dang / gzhi dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / brgal ba'i lan dang / rten dang ; grogs dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang /
translated: The essence of nonconceptual wisdom, its basis, its ground, its object, its aspect, its refutation of objections, its support, its companion, its evolutionary development, its natural outcome,

original: nges par 'byung ba dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / sbyor ba las byung ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rjes las thob pa'i phan yon dang / rab tu dbye ba dang // rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rjes las thob pa'i dpe dang /🔽lhun gyis grub par bya ba sgrub pa dang / zab pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba dang / sbyor ba las byung ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rjes las thob pa'i phan yon dang / rab tu dbye ba dang // rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rjes las thob pa'i dpe dang / lhun gyis grub par bya ba sgrub pa dang / zab pa nyid kyis kyang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: its renunciation, its culmination, its application, its nonconceptuality, its aftermath, its benefits, its analysis, its nonconceptuality, its aftermath, its similes,🔽its spontaneous accomplishment, and its accomplishment through profundity.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par du blta bar bya'o //🔽de la rnam pa lngas rnam par spangs pa ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par du blta bar bya'o // de la rnam pa lngas rnam par spangs pa ni /
translated: Nonconceptual wisdom should be understood as the distinctive excellence of superior wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Therein, the fivefold abandonment is the essence of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yid la mi byed pa yongs su spangs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las shin tu 'da' ba yongs su spangs pa dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba yongs su spangs pa dang /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa yongs su spangs pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las shin tu 'da' ba yongs su spangs pa dang / 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa nye bar zhi ba yongs su spangs pa dang /
translated: It is the avoidance of the mental nonengagement of the Sravakas, the avoidance of the transcendence of the stage of investigation and analysis, and the avoidance of the pacification of the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa dang / de kho na'i don la bkra bar 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid yongs su spangs pa dang / de kho na'i don la bkra bar 'dzin pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the avoidance of the intrinsic reality of form and the avoidance of the apprehension of variegated things in the meaning of thatness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: Nonconceptual intuition

original: rnam pa 'di lnga yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lnga yongs su spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the avoidance of these five aspects.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa 'dir tshigs su bcas pa /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnam par gzhag pa ji skad bstan pa 'dir tshigs su bcas pa /
translated: The following verse is a summary of the presentation of nonconceptual intuition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
translated: The bodhisattvas know

original: @34b rnam pa rtog med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: @34b rnam pa rtog med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: the nonconceptual intuition

original: rnam pa lnga ni rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni rnam spangs shing //
translated: which is the avoidance of five aspects

original: yang dag don la bkrar 'dzin med //
analyzed: yang dag don la bkrar 'dzin med //
translated: and the nonapprehension of variegated things in the meaning of thatness.🔽The bodhisattvas know

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
translated: the nonconceptual intuition🔽which is the avoidance of five aspects🔽and the nonapprehension of variegated things in the meaning of thatness.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas //
translated: The basis of nonconceptuality

original: sems min sems ni kho na ste //
analyzed: sems min sems ni kho na ste //
translated: Is not the mind, but is the mind.

original: don la mi sems rgyus byung phyir //
analyzed: don la mi sems rgyus byung phyir //
translated: Because it arises from the cause of the mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes //
translated: It is known by the bodhisattvas.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzhi //
translated: The basis of nonconceptuality

original: thos pa'i bag chags rjod bcas pa'i //
analyzed: thos pa'i bag chags rjod bcas pa'i //
translated: Is the mental activity of the imprints of listening,

original: yid byed de ni tshul bzhin no //
analyzed: yid byed de ni tshul bzhin no //

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /🔽snying rje'i bdag nyid ye shes kyis //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa / snying rje'i bdag nyid ye shes kyis //
translated: Here is a verse:🔽The compassionate nature,

original: rnam lnga khyad par 'phags pa rnams //🔽'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa yi //
analyzed: rnam lnga khyad par 'phags pa rnams // 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa yi //
translated: with five distinctions of knowledge,🔽is said to be close to the perfection

original: phun sum tshogs dang mi ring brjod //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs dang mi ring brjod //
translated: of mundane and supramundane excellence.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhing nor thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de ltar lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i zhing nor thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva thus possesses the excellence of the qualities of superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom, then he attains mastery over all wealth.

original: ci'i phyir sems can brel phongs can dag snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can brel phongs can dag snang zhe na /
translated: Why do they appear to be poor and destitute?

original: sems can de dag la de'i bgegs su gyur ba'i las mthong ba dang / longs spyod de nye bar sgrub na dge ba'i chos skye ba'i bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong ba dang // kun tu skye ba mngon du gyur par mthong ba dang /
analyzed: sems can de dag la de'i bgegs su gyur ba'i las mthong ba dang / longs spyod de nye bar sgrub na dge ba'i chos skye ba'i bar du gcod pa nyid du mthong ba dang // kun tu skye ba mngon du gyur par mthong ba dang /
translated: They see that for those sentient beings, wealth is an obstacle, they see that if they were to provide wealth, it would be an obstacle to the arising of virtuous qualities, they see that it would lead to manifest rebirth,

original: longs spyod de nye bar sgrub na mi dge ba'i chos sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba dang / longs spyod de nye bar sgrub pa nyid de las gzhan pa'i sems can ches mang ba dag la gnod pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod de nye bar sgrub na mi dge ba'i chos sogs pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba dang / longs spyod de nye bar sgrub pa nyid de las gzhan pa'i sems can ches mang ba dag la gnod pa'i rgyu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: they see that if they were to provide wealth, it would be the cause of nonvirtuous qualities, and they see that providing wealth would be the cause of harm to many other sentient beings.

original: sems can brel phongs can dag snang ngo //
analyzed: sems can brel phongs can dag snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, they appear to be poor and destitute.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:🔽Because of karmic obscurations, manifest afflictions,

original: las kyi sgrib dang mngon 'gyur dang // sogs dang gnod byed mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib dang mngon 'gyur dang // sogs dang gnod byed mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: and so on, and because of seeing harm,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ni //
translated: the bodhisattvas

original: sems can longs spyod mi 'thob brjod //
analyzed: sems can longs spyod mi 'thob brjod //
translated: say that sentient beings do not obtain wealth.

original: de ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar lhag pa'i shes rab kyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: Thus the excellence of superior wisdom has been shown.

original: spong ba'i khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
analyzed: spong ba'i khyad par ji ltar blta zhe na /
translated: How should the excellence of elimination be seen?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spong ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spong ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang yin pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the bodhisattvas is the nondwelling nirvana.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Its characteristic is

original: gang nyon mongs pa yongs su btang ba dang @36b bcas pas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gnas te gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa yongs su btang ba dang @36b bcas pas 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gnas te gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: the transformation of the basis, which is the nonrelinquishment of samsara by relinquishing the afflictions.

original: de la 'khor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, samsara is the other-dependent nature that is included in the class of affliction.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de nyid rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni de nyid rnam par byang ba'i char gtogs pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is that very nature when it is included in the class of purification.

original: gnas ni de nyid gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni de nyid gnyi ga'i char gtogs pa ste /
translated: The basis is that very nature when it is included in both classes.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the other-dependent nature.

original: gzhan gyur pa ni gang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid kyi gnyen po skyes nas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha ldog cing rnam par byang ba'i char gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyur pa ni gang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de nyid kyi gnyen po skyes nas gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i cha ldog cing rnam par byang ba'i char gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the other-dependent is that very essential nature of the other-dependent itself, when its antidote arises and the aspect of the afflicted is eliminated and the aspect of purification is attained.

original: gyur pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /🔽nyam chung bar byed cing rgyas par gyur pa ni mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa'i bag chags gnas pa dang / 'dzem pa dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa chung ngu tsam kun tu 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: gyur pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste / nyam chung bar byed cing rgyas par gyur pa ni mos pa'i dbang gis thos pa'i bag chags gnas pa dang / 'dzem pa dang bcas pa la nyon mongs pa chung ngu tsam kun tu 'byung ba'am /
translated: This transformation is summarized as six kinds:

original: kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The transformation of weakness and expansion is due to the power of faith, because the latent impressions of hearing are present and because the affliction arises or does not arise in a weak form in one who is conscientious.

original: rtogs nas gyur pa ni sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste sa drug pa'i bar du de kho na dang de kho na ma yin pa snang ba nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs nas gyur pa ni sar chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste sa drug pa'i bar du de kho na dang de kho na ma yin pa snang ba nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The transformation of realization is that of the bodhisattvas who have entered the stages, because the appearance of reality and unreality is present up to the sixth stage.

original: bsgom pas gyur pa ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas gyur pa ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The transformation of meditation is that of those who have obscurations.

original: sa bcu'i bar du mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba dang / de kho na snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu'i bar du mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba dang / de kho na snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: On the ten stages, all signs do not appear and reality appears, because of the absence of all signs and the appearance of reality.

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'gyur ba ni sgrib pa med pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'gyur ba ni sgrib pa med pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The transformation of the completion of the result belongs to those who are without obscurations.

original: mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de kho na snang ba dang / mtshan ma thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad mi snang ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i de kho na snang ba dang / mtshan ma thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All signs do not appear and reality appears in a very pure way, because of the attainment of mastery over all signs.

original: 'gyur pa dman pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: 'gyur pa dman pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
translated: The inferior transformation belongs to the sravakas.

original: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / 'khor ba la shin tu rgyab kyis bltas pas 'khor ba shin tu yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / 'khor ba la shin tu rgyab kyis bltas pas 'khor ba shin tu yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of the selflessness of the person and the complete rejection of cyclic existence, since they turn their back on cyclic existence.

original: rgyur pa rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rgyur pa rgya che ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
translated: The vast transformation belongs to the bodhisattvas.

original: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / de nyid la zhi bar mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa spong zhing yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la bdag med par rtogs pa dang / de nyid la zhi bar mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa spong zhing yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realization of the selflessness of phenomena and the complete rejection of the afflictions, since they see reality as peace.

original: gyur pa dman pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin na nyes dmigs cing yod ce na /
analyzed: gyur pa dman pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin na nyes dmigs cing yod ce na /
translated: If the transformation of the bodhisattvas is inferior, what is the disadvantage?

original: sems can gyi don la mi lta bas byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las shin tu 'das te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la mi lta bas byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las shin tu 'das te /
translated: Because they do not consider the welfare of sentient beings, they completely transcend the nature of a bodhisattva.

original: theg pa dman pa pa rnams dang rnam par thar pa mtshungs pa'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa pa rnams dang rnam par thar pa mtshungs pa'i nyes dmigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: The disadvantage is that they are the same as those of the Individual Vehicle in their liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gyur pa rgya chen po la phan yon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gyur pa rgya chen po la phan yon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the benefit of the extensive transformation of the bodhisattvas?

original: rang bzhin gnas gyur pa'i gzhis 'khor ba'i chos thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir te /🔽'gro ba @37a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnas gyur pa'i gzhis 'khor ba'i chos thams cad la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir te / 'gro ba @37a * //
translated: Because they attain mastery over all dharmas of cyclic life on the basis of the transformation of the fundamental consciousness.

original: thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi lus ston pas 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis mngon par ma thob dang / theg pa gsum po dag la 'dul zhing 'god pa ni phan yon no //
analyzed: thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi lus ston pas 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis mngon par ma thob dang / theg pa gsum po dag la 'dul zhing 'god pa ni phan yon no //
translated: They manifest bodies in all worlds for all sentient beings and by means of various skillful means they discipline and establish them in the three vehicles. This is the benefit.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcas pa //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcas pa //
translated: Here there is a verse:

original: byis pa rnams la yang dag bsgribs //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la yang dag bsgribs //
translated: They are obscured to the immature.

original: yang dag ma yin kun tu snad //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun tu snad //
translated: And the unreal appears.

original: de bstsal yang dag thams cad du //
analyzed: de bstsal yang dag thams cad du //
translated: When that is eliminated, the real

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snang //
translated: appears to the bodhisattvas.

original: don med pa dang don yod pa //
analyzed: don med pa dang don yod pa //
translated: The unreal and the real

original: mi snang snang bar shes par bya //
analyzed: mi snang snang bar shes par bya //
translated: should be understood as nonappearance and appearance.

original: gnas ni gzhan du gyur pa de //
analyzed: gnas ni gzhan du gyur pa de //
translated: That transformation of the basis

original: 'dod dgur rgyu phyir thar pa yin //🔽'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'dod dgur rgyu phyir thar pa yin // 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: is liberation, since one moves as one wishes.🔽When one realizes that samsara and nirvana

original: mtshungs par shes pa nam skye ba //
analyzed: mtshungs par shes pa nam skye ba //
translated: are the same,

original: de tshe de phyir de la ni //
analyzed: de tshe de phyir de la ni //
translated: then, because of that,

original: 'khor nyid mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor nyid mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //
translated: samsara itself becomes nirvana.

original: de yi phyir na 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: de yi phyir na 'khor ba ni //
translated: Therefore, samsara

original: gtong ba ma yin mi gtong min //
analyzed: gtong ba ma yin mi gtong min //
translated: is neither abandoned nor not abandoned.

original: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa yang //
analyzed: de phyir mya ngan 'das pa yang //
translated: Therefore, nirvana

original: thob pa ma yin mi thob min //
analyzed: thob pa ma yin mi thob min //
translated: is neither attained nor not attained.

original: de ltar spong ba'i khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spong ba'i khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the distinctive abandonment,

original: ye shes kyi khyad par ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par ji ltar blta bar bya zhe na /
translated: how should one view the distinctive gnosis?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum po ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus ye shes kyi khyad par du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku gsum po ngo bo nyid dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus ye shes kyi khyad par du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The three Buddha bodies should be viewed as the special qualities of the intuition.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The essential body is that of the Tathagatas, the Dharma Body,

original: thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of mastery over all things.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni /
translated: The beatific body is that of the Buddhas,

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyis rab tu phye ba dang / chos kyi sku la brten pa ste /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyis rab tu phye ba dang / chos kyi sku la brten pa ste /
translated: which is distinguished by the various circles of its retinue, and is based on the Dharma Body,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / theg pa chen po chos kyi longs spyod myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / theg pa chen po chos kyi longs spyod myong bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the enjoyment of the Great Vehicle Dharma and the purification of the Buddha land.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni gang chos kyi sku la brten pa nyid de dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni gang chos kyi sku la brten pa nyid de dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The emanation body is that of the Buddhas, which is based on the Dharma Body, and is distinguished by its descent from the Tuṣita abode,

original: 'pho ba dang / bltams pa dang / 'dod pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mu stegs can gyi gang du gshegs pa dang / dka' pa spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang / bltams pa dang / 'dod pa la spyod pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / mu stegs can gyi gang du gshegs pa dang / dka' pa spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po kun tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the descent into the womb, the birth, the enjoyment of sense objects, the departure from home, the journey to the realm of the tirthikas, the practice of austerities, the sitting at the site of enlightenment, the enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and the great parinirvana.

original: 'dir sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a summary verse:

original: mtshan nyid dang ni 'thob pa dang // dbang dang gnas dang yongs su bsdus dang // dbye dang yon tan zab pa dang // dran dang phrin las sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni 'thob pa dang // dbang dang gnas dang yongs su bsdus dang // dbye dang yon tan zab pa dang // dran dang phrin las sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: The characteristics, the attainment, the powers, the stations, the totalities, the liberations, the concentrations, the stages, the vows, the morality, the tolerance, the heroism, the meditation, the wisdom, the skillful means, the aspiration, and the knowledge are the ten perfections.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi @37b mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi @37b mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of the buddhas?

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The Dharma body.

original: mdor bsdu na mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be known as having five characteristics.🔽What are the five?

original: gnas gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams par log na sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol zhing chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nye bar gnas pa rnams
analyzed: gnas gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i char gtogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams par log na sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol zhing chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba nye bar gnas pa rnams
translated: The characteristic of transformation is that when the dependent reality, which is included in the defiled class, is completely reversed in relation to all obscurations, one is freed from all obscurations and has mastery over all phenomena.

original: par byang ba'i char gtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par byang ba'i char gtogs pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dependent reality becomes included in the class of the completely purified.

original: dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs nas /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs nas /
translated: The characteristic of the nature of positive qualities is that once the six transcendent perfections have been completed,

original: dbang bcu thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang bcu thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: one acquires the ten masteries.

original: de la tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are mastery over longevity, mastery over mind, mastery over requisites and mastery over action, which come from completing the transcendent perfection of generosity;

original: las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of action and mastery of birth are due to the perfection of morality.

original: mos pa la dbang ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa la dbang ba ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of will is due to the perfection of patience.

original: smon lam la dbang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam la dbang ba ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of vows is due to the perfection of vigor.

original: mngon par shes pa lngas bsdus pa'i rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lngas bsdus pa'i rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of superknowledges, which includes the supernormal powers, is due to the perfection of meditation.

original: ye shes la dbang ba dang chos la dbang ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang ba dang chos la dbang ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mastery of knowledge and mastery of teaching are due to the perfection of wisdom.

original: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang / stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of non-duality is that all things are unreal because of the characteristic of the non-duality of existence and non-existence, and are real because of the characteristic of emptiness.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid dang / 'dus byas su snang ba kun tu ston pa la dbang 'byor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid ni las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus ma byas pa nyid dang / 'dus byas su snang ba kun tu ston pa la dbang 'byor ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po gyur ba'i phyir zhing dang / lus dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / dbyangs mtha' yas pa dang / spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba la dbang 'byor ba dang / tshor ba'i phung po gyur ba'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med cing tshad med la rgya che ba'i bde bar gnas pa la dbang 'byor pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung po gyur ba'i phyir ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / ye ge'i tshogs thams cad kyis bstan pa la dbang 'byor ba dang / 'du byed kyi phung po gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the aggregate of feeling has changed, they have mastery over the infinite and vast bliss of the state free from wrongdoing.🔽Because the aggregate of perception has changed, they have mastery over the teachings of all the collections of names, collections of words and collections of letters.🔽Because the aggregate of formation has changed, they have mastery over emanations, transformation, gathering retinues and gathering positive qualities.

original: sprul pa dang / bsgyur pa dang / 'khor bsdu ba dang / dkar po'i chos bsdu ba la dbang 'byor ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po gnas gyur ba'i phyir /

translated: One attains mastery by mastering the mirrorlike, the sameness, the individually discriminating, and the allaccomplishing intuitive wisdoms.

original: chos kyi sku gnas ngu zhig gi gnas nyid du rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi sku gnas ngu zhig gi gnas nyid du rig par bya zhe na /

original: mdor bsdu na gsum gyi gnas te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na gsum gyi gnas te /
translated: In brief, it is the basis of three things:

original: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa sna tshogs kyi gnas ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa sna tshogs kyi gnas ni /
translated: the basis of the various states of buddhahood,🔽the basis of the various states of sentient beings,🔽and the basis of the various states of both.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /

original: gang phyir sangs rgyas rang gi dbyings brnyes nas //
analyzed: gang phyir sangs rgyas rang gi dbyings brnyes nas //

original: @38b rnam pa lnga yi bdag nyid dgyes brnyes la //
analyzed: @38b rnam pa lnga yi bdag nyid dgyes brnyes la //

original: de ma thob pas dga' dang bral gyur ba //
analyzed: de ma thob pas dga' dang bral gyur ba //

original: de phyir de 'dod pas na de thob byos //
analyzed: de phyir de 'dod pas na de thob byos //
translated: Therefore, those who desire it should attain it.🔽The buddhas have attained the supreme bliss,🔽which is uncontaminated by the world,🔽which is the inexhaustible vision of power,🔽accomplishment of deeds, taste of Dharma,

original: mthu dang bya ba grub dang chos ro dang // don dang yon tan 'byor ba dpag med dang // rtag tu mi zad gzigs pas sangs rgyas rnams //🔽dgyes mchog kha na ma tho med pa brnyes //
analyzed: mthu dang bya ba grub dang chos ro dang // don dang yon tan 'byor ba dpag med dang // rtag tu mi zad gzigs pas sangs rgyas rnams //🔽dgyes mchog kha na ma tho med pa brnyes //
translated: meaning, and immeasurable wealth of qualities.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sna tshogs kyi gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku sna tshogs kyi gnas ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The enjoyment body is the basis of the various enjoyments because it causes the full maturation of the bodhisattvas.

original: sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs kyi gnas ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs kyi gnas ni /
translated: The emanation body is the basis of the various emanations

original: phal cher nyan thos rnams yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher nyan thos rnams yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the full maturation of the śrāvakas for the most part.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos du zhig gis chos kyi sku bsdus par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos du zhig gis chos kyi sku bsdus par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By how many buddha qualities is the Dharma body to be understood as being comprised?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug gis bsdus te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug gis bsdus te /
translated: In brief, it is comprised by six kinds:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes par gyur nas chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pas ni kun gzhi rnam par shes par gyur nas chos kyi sku thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the purity of the buddha qualities, because having become the container consciousness, the attainment of the Dharma body results.

original: rnam par smin pa bas ni dbang po gzugs can gyur nas rnam par smin pa ba'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa bas ni dbang po gzugs can gyur nas rnam par smin pa ba'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the evolutionary maturity, because having become the material faculties, the attainment of the evolutionary maturity of intuition results.

original: gnas pas ni 'dod pa la spyod pa la sogs pa la gnas par gyur nas ye shes tshad med pas gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pas ni 'dod pa la spyod pa la sogs pa la gnas par gyur nas ye shes tshad med pas gnas pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the stations, because having become the stations of the desire realm, etc., the attainment of the station of immeasurable intuition results.

original: dbang 'byor ba bas ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba bas ni yongs su 'dzin pa'i las sna tshogs gyur nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By mastery, because having become the various activities of appropriation, they attain mastery of the knowledge of the unobstructed higher perceptions in all world systems.

original: tha snyad pas ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad brjod par gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi sems tshim par bya ba'i bstan pa mkhyen pa la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad pas ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad brjod par gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi sems tshim par bya ba'i bstan pa mkhyen pa la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By convention, because having become the conventional expressions of seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and knowing, they attain mastery of the knowledge of teaching in order to satisfy the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sel ba bas ni gnod pa dang // nyes pa thams cad sel bar gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad sel ba mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sel ba bas ni gnod pa dang // nyes pa thams cad sel bar gyur nas sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa thams cad sel ba mkhyen pa brnyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: By removal, because having become the removal of all harm and faults, they attain the knowledge of removing all the harms of all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di drug gis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di drug gis /
translated: By these six qualities of the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: the Dharma body of the buddhas should be understood as being summarized.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ci tha dad pa zhes bya ba'am /🔽tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ci tha dad pa zhes bya ba'am / tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Is the Dharma Body of the Buddhas, the Exalted Ones, different or not different?

original: gnas dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las tha dad pa med pas tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang / dgongs pa dang / phrin las tha dad pa med pas tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not different because of non-difference in support, intention, and action.

original: lus tshad med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus tshad med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is different because of the manifestation of infinite bodies.

original: chos kyi sku ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the Dharma Body,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku @39a * //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku @39a * //
translated: so also the Enjoyment Body

original: yang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa med pas tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa dang phrin las tha dad pa med pas tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: is not different because of non-difference in intention and action.

original: gnas tha dad pas tha dad pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas tha dad pas tha dad pa med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not not different because of difference in support.

original: gnas tshad med pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas tshad med pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not not different because of the appearance of infinite supports.

original: sprul pa'i sku yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bzhin du blta bar bya'o //

original: chos kyi sku de yon tan du zhig dang ldan par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi sku de yon tan du zhig dang ldan par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What qualities should the Dharma Body be understood to possess?

original: shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshad med pa bzhin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su dag pa'i tshad med pa bzhin dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa drug dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa bzhi dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: the four immeasurables that are completely pure, the eight deliverances, the eight masteries, the ten totalities, the absence of conflict, knowledge through aspiration,🔽the four correct knowledges, the six superknowledges, the thirty-two marks of a great being, the eighty minor marks, the four complete purities, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / bsrung ba med pa gsum dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the three things that need not be guarded against, the three foundations of mindfulness, the complete destruction of the habitual tendencies, the nature of not forgetting, great compassion, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan no //
translated: He is endowed with the highest form, omniscience, and the perfection of the six perfections.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcas pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcas pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

analyzed: sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba // phrad dang bral bar dgongs pa can //

original: mi 'bral dgongs shing bde dang ldan //
analyzed: mi 'bral dgongs shing bde dang ldan //

analyzed: sems can kun gyis khyod mthong na //

analyzed: skyes bu mchog tu rtogs par 'gyur //
